movie.info: Pitch Black Writers : David Twohy Genres : HorrorSci-FiThriller

scene.meta: A CRYO-LOCKER BLOWS OPEN, spitting out... CAROLYN FRY. She hits the deck of the main cabin: Four crew lockers in a forward section, countless more in back. But the deck is canted at a sick angle and ALARMS SCREAM everywhere: The world is dying around her. Legs wobbly, shivering like a flu victim, Fry stumbles to the next forward locker. It's riddled with holes. One DEAD CREWIE is seen through fractured plexi, body pocked and bloodied. But in the next cryo-locked... The CAPTAIN is struggling awake. Fry's face floods with relief. Slapping an intercom:

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Hear me? Cap'n? Some kinda compromise to the hull...holding for now, but...Goddamn, I'm glad you're alive. Gotta pull your E-release...no, red handle, red handle. I'll get the warm-ups out while --

scene.meta: PHFUT-PHFUT-PHFUT-PHFUT: Particles bore through the cabin, blasting open the captain's chest, shattering plexi, DETONATING INSTRUMENTS on the opposite wall and leaving CONTRAILS HISSING in the air. Fry lands on her ass, horrified. Suddenly... Another LOCKER BLOWS OPEN. A body falls right on top of Fry -- but this one's still alive. Disoriented, frantic:

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: Why did I fall on you?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: He's dead. Cap'n's dead. Christ, I was looking right at him when --

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: I mean, I mean, chrono shows we're 22 weeks out, so gravity wasn't supposed to kick in for another 19. I mean, I mean, I mean, why did I fall at all?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: You hear me? Captain's dead. Owens too.

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: Oh, no. Not Owens, not.... Wai', wai', wait. I'm Owens. Right?

scene.meta: They swap nightmare looks, momentarily unsure of their own identities.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Cryo-sleep. Swear to God, it sloughs brain cells.

scene.meta: They stumble into nav-bay. ALARMS CONTINUE. Fry grabs warm-up suits out of storage, pitches one to Owens, checks her screens.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: 1550 millibars, dropping 20 MB per minute, shit, we're hemorrhaging air. Somethin' took a swipe at us.

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: Just tell me we're still in the shipping lane. Just show me all those stars, all those bright, beautiful, deep-space....

scene.meta: Owens activates an exterior view: A planet rushes up at us. That's why they have gravity.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Jesus God....

scene.meta: The SHIP PLOWS through the upper atmosphere, antennae pylons already disintegrating.
Heart battering her ribs, Fry runs forward, using hand-holds to steady herself. Over a headset:

char.name: OWENS (V.O.)
char.dialogue: They trained you for this, right? Fry? FRY?

scene.meta: She doesn't answer.

Fry harnesses in, starts running switches -- but fumbles a few times, making mental errors. Finally she gets crash-shutters open to reveal... CLOUD STRATA sweeping up past the windscreen like floor-lights on a dropping elevator. We're shedding big altitude.

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: ... crisis program selected Number Two of this system because it shows at least some oxygen and more than 1,500 -- would you SHUT THE FUCK UP! (hammers a button,

char.name: SILENCES ALARMS)
char.dialogue: -- more than 1,500-millibars of pressure at surface-level. Okay, so maybe the ship did something right for a change....

scene.meta: As Fry runs more switches.
As JETTISON DOORS CLOSE around the ship.
As Fry flips up a security-latch -- and thumbs the switch below.

MULTIPLE SHOTS: EXPLOSIVE BOLTS RAPID-FIRE around the ship's skin, blowing away non-essentials that hinder aerodynamics -- including big deep-space drives. But this last separation puts the ship into a dangerous roll.
Out the windscreen, cloud strata roll vertiginously. Fry throws actuators...
And airbrakes deploy. She manages to kill the roll. But the ship's still coming in nose-high.

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: ...showing no major water bodies...maximum terrain, 220 meters over mean surface... largely cinder and gypsum with some evaporite deposits....

scene.meta: JETTISON DOORS CLOSE behind Owens, segregating him from the passenger compartment. It scares him for a new reason.

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: Fry? What're you doing?

scene.meta: Fry flips up a new security-latch. INTERCUTTING:

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: Fry?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Can't get my nose down...too much load back there....

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: You mean that "load" of passengers?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: So what, we should both go down too? Out of sheer fucking nobility?

scene.meta: Tortured silence. Fry's thumb moves to the switch that will jettison the passenger cabin. Jettison 50 people.

SELECTED SHOTS of faces inside cryo-lockers, among them JOHNS. He's prime-of-life, badge on display, some kind of cop. Shaken awake, he clears condensation to check the locker directly across from his, finding... RIDDICK. Small black goggles hide his eyes. A metal bit wedged in his mouth lends a perpetual grimace. A read-out admonishes "LOCK-OUT PROTOCOL IN EFFECT. ABSOLUTELY NO EARLY

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: Look, Fry. Company says we're responsible for every one of those --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Company's not here, is it?

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: When captain went down, you stepped up -- whether you like it or not. Now they train you for this, so --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: And there wasn't a simulated cockroach alive within 50 clicks of the simulated crash site! That's how they train you! On a fucking simulator!

scene.meta: Owens unbuckles from his chair.

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: Don't touch that switch!

scene.meta: Overcome by guilt, Fry retracts her thumb of mass destruction. But a HUGE JOLT puts the thumb right back.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I'm not dying for them.

scene.meta: She pushes it. But this time...
No bolts fire. Nothing separates from the SHIP THAT SCREAMS DOWN through the clouds.
Now we see why: Owens reopened the jettison doors locally -- and blocked them open.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Owens!

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: 70 seconds! You still got 70 seconds to level this beast out!

scene.meta: Seething anger and guilt, Fry pops more airbrakes, shedding more speed, more heat. The ship does level -- but it's still being pounded hellishly. She tries to get a stable view out... The windscreen. We're breaking through cloud-bottoms. There's just a glimpse of landscape before...
An airbrake fails. It shears off and pinwheels into...
The windscreen. It cracks into a thousand spiderwebs -- but impossibly it holds. For now.

char.name: OWENS (V.O.)
char.dialogue: What the shit was that?

scene.meta: Sunlight flares from every fractured edge: It's like looking into burning diamonds, and Fry can only get an impression of the outside world. Now she has to rely on... A ground-mapping display. 120 meters altitude. And dropping.
INTERCUT Johns. Realizing he's in some kind of shit-storm, he claws at safety restraints.

Ground-mapper: 60 meters. COLLISION ALARMS kick in. Out the fractured windscreen, we see a huge dark mass rise up into view. Land. 40 meters...30...20...10.... Fry braces. IMPACT. The WINDSCREENS IMPLODE. AIR HURRICANES in.
IMPACT. Chairs rip from their moorings. Strapped into one, Owens slams into the ceiling.

IMPACT. Johns BLOWS OUT of his locker -- and wishes to God he would've stayed inside, because just beside him... The hull is cracking open. NIGHTMARE SHOT: A huge section of the cabin tears free... skitters and CRASHES along the planetfloor behind us...and disintegrates out of sight. 40 cryo-lockers vanished with it. 40 lives.

Hammered by WIND, Fry opens her eyes experimentally. FRY'S POV: A vortex of motion, of speed, of blurring debris. But the ship is burrowing in. Burrowing under. Fry pivots her chair 180 degrees a nanosecond before... Dirt avalanches into the cockpit. It buries CAMERA.

scene.sceneheader: INT. MAIN CABIN - CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: Choking yellow dust. Ghostly silhouettes are COUGHING, MOANING, CALLING OUT to other survivors in English and, surreally, in Arabic. Soon we find... Johns. Ears running blood. Stumbling his way to... Riddick's cryo-locker. Empty. Johns reaches for his holster. Gone, torn right off his belt. No prisoner and no weapon -- spooky combination. Nearby he sees... The light of a cutting torch. Someone's using it to open a jammed cryo-locker. The plexi is torched away to reveal... AUDREY, 12 years old. Unscathed.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Somethin' went wrong, huh?

scene.meta: Johns searches for his pistol. Behind him, two chained feet lower into FRAME -- and then attack, swinging over Johns' head... getting the chain on his neck...twisting hard, using the chain as a choke-collar. Johns flicks open a baton, swings it up at... Riddick. Still in body chains and mouth-bit. Clinging to a ceiling support. Riding out the baton blows. Seconds from blacking out, Johns strains forward...forward...and finally breaks Riddick's grip on the support. He keeps hold of the chained feet so that... Riddick SLAMS HEADFIRST into the deck. Johns lays the baton on his neck.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: One chance and you blew it, Riddick. Never cease to disappoint me.

scene.sceneheader: INT. FLIGHT DECK - CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: Darkness. A light beam sweeps the dusty air of the cockpit. It's packed with dirt, no signs of life. About to search elsewhere, Johns turns back at...

char.name: FRY (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Hey.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Hey, who?

char.name: FRY (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Hey, me. Over here.

scene.meta: His light finds a headrest sticking up from the dirt. Johns crawls closer, checks the other side of the headrest and finds her. Fry. Buried to the gills.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Amazing. I'm Johns.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Carolyn Fry. I'd shake hands, but...

scene.meta: He manages a smile and starts digging her out. Almost dreading to ask:

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Are there any others, Johns?

scene.sceneheader: INT. MAIN CABIN - CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: Johns helps Fry through the carnage. She's stunned by it all -- but especially by the blast of sunlight where a hull used to be. Realizing she's in nav-bay, Fry starts digging like a search dog to uncover... Owens. Still strapped to his chair. Metal rod piercing his chest close to the heart. Dead. Fry reaches out to touch him.

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: Out, out, out, GET IT OUTTA ME!

scene.meta: She recoils hard. He's still alive. The other survivors bungle over. Ten seconds of pure chaos:

char.name: VOICES
char.dialogue: Pull it out of him...No, it's too close to the heart...You gotta do it, just do it fast....

scene.meta: Fry grabs the rod.

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: Don't touch it! Don't touch that switch!

char.name: VOICES
char.dialogue: You'll kill him, I'm tellin' you, shit, just leave it alone...delirious...doncha you got some drugs for this poor man....

char.name: OWENS
char.dialogue: Don't touch that switch!

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Awright, awright, someone...there's Anestaphine in the med-lock, that end of the cabin...next to....

scene.meta: But there is no more "that end." In exquisite pain, Owens screams on. REACTION SHOTS of Johns, Audrey. Seldom are human beings witness to such raw suffering.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Get away. Everybody.

scene.meta: The others leave -- except for Audrey, staying behind to watch in morbid fascination. Johns doubles back and collars her. Leaving, they pass... Riddick, cuffed to a bulkhead. His eyes, still hidden by goggles, track Johns and Audrey toward daylight.

The survivors straggle outside. CAMERA SURVEYS new faces: ZEKE and SHAZZA. Male-female team of bushwhackers, partners in life. Shazza has a tough sexiness. Zeke's face shows aboriginal blood. (30s.) PARIS. Overfed, overgroomed. A puff pastry of a man. (40s or 50s.) Four male "Chrislams": The pillar-steady IMAM (50ish), and THREE PILGRIMS, young and excitable (late-teens). (NOTE: The Chrislams represent a union between Christianity and Islam. They have the iconography of Christians yet the physical look of Arab Muslims.) WIDE SHOT: All around them is stark and unforgiving terrain. The valley floor is relieved only by low hills to one side, spiked with earthen spires. Scorching down on everything are two suns -- one red, one yellow.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Well. Our own little slice of heaven.

scene.meta: The Chrislams fall to their knees. Confusion as they try to orient themselves.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Please...which way to New Mecca? We must know the direction in order to pray.

scene.meta: North? South? East? West? Nobody knows. Johns snaps open a compass, finds the needle swaying rudderlessly. The SCREAMING inside the ship finally ends.
As Fry holds Owens, now dead.
The four Chrislams have devised a way to pray: Backs together, each faces a different compass point.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TOP OF CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: Fry climbs onto the back of the ship. Johns Paris, Zeke, Shazza, Audrey are already here.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Big talk about a scouting party...

scene.meta: Fry sees the huge smoldering scar in the ground behind the ship. One glance confirms that there are no other survivors.

char.name: JOHNS (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: ...then we saw this.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Anyone else having breathing problems? Aside from me?

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Like I just ran, or something....

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Feel one lung short. All of us.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Well, I tend toward the asthmatic. And with all this dust....

scene.meta: Faces turn to Fry: They're looking to her for answers.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: It's the atmosphere. Too much pressure, not enough oxygen. Might take a few days to --

char.name: ZEKE
char.dialogue: So what the bloody hell happened, anyways?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Somethin' knocked us off-lane. Maybe a rogue comet. Maybe we'll never know.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Well, I for one, am thoroughly fucking grateful. This beast wasn't made to land like this. But cripes, you rode it down. (to others) C'mon, you lousy ingrates, only reason we're alive is a'cuzza her.

scene.meta: Others CHIME AGREEMENT, laying thankful hands on Fry's shoulders. HOLD on Fry, her face betraying nothing as they anoint her their savior.

scene.sceneheader: INT. MAIN CABIN - CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: Breaking out pressure suits:

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Liquid oxygen canisters inside. Start ripping them out. Quick hits only -- try to make it last.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Well, is someone coming for us? Or are we all just gonna die of exposure or dehydration or sunstroke or maybe even something worse? (off their looks) Hey, you don't have to worry about scaring me.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: We're worried you'll scare us. (ushering her away) Name's "Audrey," right, love? And you're goin' to Taurus Three like we were?

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Yeah, but...do we even have enough food to get there? Or will we have to resort to cannibalism?

char.name: ZEKE
char.dialogue: (to Fry) I'll see 'bout makin' this air go a bit further, cap'n. With your permission, a' course.

scene.meta: Fry blinks. "They actually think I'm the captain." Zeke and the others get to work. Fry finds herself staring at another problem. Riddick.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: And him?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Big Evil?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: We just keep him locked up forever?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Be my choice. Already escaped once from the max-slam facility on --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I don't need his life story. Is he really that dangerous?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Only around humans.

scene.meta: Riddick has his mouth on the hull, virtually licking the metal. Fry moves closer -- and now sees it sheeting down the hull.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Oh, Christ....

scene.meta: They're losing water. Suddenly Fry is running, snatching up an emergency light, climbing wall-rungs...

scene.sceneheader: INT. MACHINE LEVEL - CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: And crawling through dusty superstructure to reach the water cistern. She opens a crank-hatch -- and finds light invading the interior. Her face dies.

char.name: ZEKE (V.O.)
char.dialogue: (shouting) Well? Is it just the pump?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Ask if anyone has anything in cargo! Anything to drink!

scene.meta: Oversize DOORS RUMBLE open. Fry, Johns, and Paris climb into this dark corridor lined with cargo containers. Each container has an access door.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Mine here....

scene.meta: As Paris unlocks, Johns steadies himself, suddenly light-headed.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: S'matter?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Little swamp-flu from the Conga system. Never shook it with all this cryo-sleep.

scene.meta: Paris opens his container to reveal...

scene.sceneheader: INT. PARIS' CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - DAY
scene.meta: Tiffany chairs stacked 10 high. Bronze eagle lecterns. Oriental umbrellas. Neo-Egyptian castings.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: King Tut's tomb....

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Be surprised what these will fetch in the Taurus system. Here. This Wooten here -- easy, easy. Very rare.

scene.meta: They open the Wooten desk. Cubbyholed inside are dusty bottles of sherry. Vintage Port. Glenfiddich. Bicardi 151.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: This is it? Booze? That's what you have to drink?

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: (educating her) 200-year-old single-malt scotch is to "booze" as foie gras is to "duck guts."

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: (cracking a bottle) A toast to whatever he just said.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: I'll need a receipt for that. (to Fry) For all these.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Top of my list.

scene.meta: She joins Johns for a drink. Entering, the Chrislams watch with both envy and aversion.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I don't suppose....

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: One of the Christian habits we didn't adopt -- perhaps unfortunately. We'll have to wait.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: For what? There is no water. You understand that, don't you?

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: All deserts have water, somewhere. God shall lead us there.

scene.sceneheader: INT. MAIN CABIN - CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: START on the cutting torch, abandoned in wreckage. Staring at it is... Riddick. With his hands cuffed behind him and around a bulkhead, he can't get near it. Or can he? Near the ceiling, the bulkhead is fractured -- a slim spot where maybe chains could pass through. Riddick stands. With a GRUESOME POPPING, he dislocates both shoulders...carries his arms overhead...passes the chains through the broken spot...and brings his arms down in front of him. A body-flex POPS HIS SHOULDERS back into joint. Free, he reaches for the cutting torch.
Pistol in hand, Johns runs into a BIG CLOSEUP, eyes sweeping. Nothing on the horizon. But something lies on the ground nearby. It's Riddick's mouth-bit.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Like we needed another way to die.

scene.meta: FAST CLOSEUPS: Hands pillaging storage lockers, pulling out anything that might qualify as a "weapon." It all gets hauled back and dumped into...

scene.sceneheader: INT. NAV BAY - CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: Nav-bay. Gathered, the survivors take inventory: Johns has a pistol, shotgun, baton. Zeke and Shazza offer up a pick-ax, digging tools, hunting boomerang. Imam shows a ceremonial blade. Paris straggles in with antique curios.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: What the hell are these?

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Maratha crow-bill war-picks from Northern India. Very rare.

char.name: ZEKE
char.dialogue: An' this?

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Blow-dart hunting stick from Papua New Guinea. Very very rare, since the tribe's extinct.

char.name: ZEKE
char.dialogue: 'Cuz they couldn't hunt shit with these things, be my guess.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Well, what's the need, anyway? If he's gone, he's gone. Why should he bother us?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: First, because he can only live out there for so long -- he's gonna come back and take what we got. Second, for the sheer thrill of the kill.

scene.meta: A beat. They all grab for weapons.

Johns stands atop the crash ship, scanning with a scope. He fixates on... A blue glow on the horizon. "What the hell is it?" Zeke and Shazza modify breather units, adding straps and tubing and ball-floats. The prototype is tested on Audrey. She sucks on the mouthpiece -- and finds that it works, supplying oxygen on demand rather than in a constant flow. Chrislams convert to traditional bedouin head-gear, readying for travel. Fry finishes wrapping Owens' body. She looks to the yellow sun, low on the horizon. The red sun seems inclined to follow.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Imam. We should leave soon. Before nightfall but while it's cooler.

char.name: ZEKE
char.dialogue: What, you're goin' off, too?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Johns is leaving you a gun. Just do me a favor, huh? Get my crewies buried? They were good guys who died bad.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: A'course we will.

char.name: PILGRIM #1 (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Imam...Imam....

scene.meta: (NOTE: "Imam" is pronounced "el-ee-MAM.") Fry and the others round the ship to see... A blue star flaring into view. It's rising as the other suns are setting.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: My bloody oath....

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Three suns?

char.name: ZEKE
char.dialogue: (to Fry) So much for your nightfall.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: So much for my cocktail hour.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: We take this to be a good sign -- a path, a direction from God.

scene.meta: Johns swings down from the top of the ship.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: A very good sign. (re: blue sun) That's Riddick's direction. You do not wanna be caught in the dark with this guy.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Thought you found his restraints over there. Toward sunset.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: (nodding) Which means he went toward sunrise.

scene.meta: Trekking, the Chrislams waft incense pots and CHANT FROM THE KORAN as they head toward the blue star. Johns provides shotgun escort; Fry carries Paris' second war-pick on a shoulder. Silhouetted against the alien sky, the scouting party is an odd, odd sight. Already sun-battered, Johns crafts an eye-visor out of plexi. Fry tries to wrap her head like the Chrislams. Imam helps.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: So quiet. You get used to the sounds of the ship, then....

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: You know who Muhammad was?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Some prophet guy?

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: "Some prophet guy." And a city man. But he had to travel to the desert -- where there was quiet -- to hear the words of God.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: You were on a pilgrimage? To New Mecca?

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: (nodding) Chrislam teaches that once in every lifetime should there be a great hajj -- a great pilgrimage. To know God, better, yes, but to know yourself as well.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Frightening thought.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: (finishes wrapping her) We're all on the same hajj now.

scene.meta: Fry notices Johns scope-locked on something.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: What?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: (hands her scope) Tell me it's not a mirage.

scene.meta: SCOPE POV: Beyond a distant rise, strange branches.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Trees?

scene.meta: Paris has taken over as look-out atop the ship. He deals with the heat by erecting a "misting" umbrella: He fills a reservoir with liquor, dials up a regulator. Umbrella spars shoot bursts of cooling alcohol vapor. Paris luxuriates in it.

char.name: ZEKE (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Comfy up there?

scene.meta: Zeke appears below. He loads a scrap-metal sled with tarp, cable, pick-ax.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Amazing how you can do without the essentials of life -- so long as you have the luxuries.

char.name: ZEKE
char.dialogue: Well, just keep your bloody-fuckin' eyes open. Don't want that ratbag sneakin' up on me bloody-fuckin' arse.

scene.meta: He drags the sled toward the spired hills. Keeping one eye on Zeke, Paris eases into a chair, lays the war-pick across his lap, pours himself a spot of sherry. As he sips, a blade touches his throat.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: He'd probably get you right here, right under the jaw. And you'd never hear him coming. That's how good Riddick is.

scene.meta: Paris eases the hunting boomerang away.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Now did you run away from your parents? Or did they run away from you?

scene.meta: The scouting party approaches a rise. The trees loom just beyond.

char.name: PILGRIMS
char.dialogue: Allahu Akbar...Allahu Akbar....

scene.meta: The young pilgrims break into a excited run, anticipating an oasis. But Fry hangs back, taking a harder look at the trees. They don't move in the wind. The pilgrims scramble up the rise -- and go motionless. Fry, Johns and Imam catch up to behold... The "trees" are actually the dorsal bones of a titanic skeleton, tinted green by lichen. Beyond is a sea of bleached animal bones. Impossibly, the bones seem to MOAN IN PAIN. All told, it's like Hell overflowed right here.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Is this whole planet dead?

scene.meta: A pilgrim questions Imam IN ARABIC.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: He asks what could have killed so many great things...

scene.meta: Moving into the boneyard:

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Some...communal graveyard, perhaps... like the elephants of Earth....

scene.meta: Fry touches one of the towering bones. It shows cut-marks -- almost as if the bone was hacked by a sword. "Graveyard? Or killing field?"

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Long time ago. Whatever happened.

scene.meta: Pilgrim #1 reaches a huge skull laced with baleen-like combing. Wind hitting the comb makes a LOW HARMONIC MOANING. By moving a hand over the comb, the pilgrim can "play" DIRGELIKE MUSIC. Wanting to show off the trick:
He looks for Pilgrim #3 but can't spot him. And when he turns back to the skull -- a face is staring through the combing. But it's only...

Pilgrim #3, inside the skull. Johns enters and chases him out. About to leave, Johns notices... Bone-chippings piled on the ground. It could be nothing, but still... Johns double-checks shadows, probing with the muzzle of his shotgun. Satisfied, Johns exits. Now BOOM UP to reveal... Riddick. Hidden in a sinus cavity.
Trailing the others, Fry pauses to change out the O2 on her breather.

Riddick drops to the ground. His arms and hands are now pierced with shards of boneyard ivory -- fashionable little body talons. Spotting a shadow on the combing, he draws closer. And sees Fry. Alone.
Johns doubles back to Fry. He takes a hit of scotch, offers her some.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Probably makes it worse. Dehydrates you even more.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Probably right.

scene.meta: They drink anyway. Moving out of the sun, Fry leans up against the combing. It brings her within arm's length of...
Riddick. He pulls a bone-shiv, freshly chiseled.

char.name: JOHNS (O.S.)
char.dialogue: You know, I woulda played road dog for these guys. You could've stayed back. Pro'bly should've -- because, you know, if we don't find water....

scene.meta: "We may not make it back."

char.name: FRY (O.S.)
char.dialogue: No, no, I wanted to get away.

char.name: JOHNS (O.S.)
char.dialogue: So I noticed. Never seen a "captain" quite so ready to leave her ship.

scene.meta: Just as Riddick eases his blade toward Fry's neck...
She steps away.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Better keep moving....

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: What'd Owens mean? 'Bout not touching the switch?

scene.meta: Fry searches his eyes, wondering if she can trust him -- and again she leans back on the combing. We can actually see Riddick now. They could too, if they would just TURN THE FUCK AROUND!

char.name: JOHNS (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: Hey. You can tell me, Carolyn.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Promise me. Swear to me you won't --

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: You see anybody else here? Just between you and me.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: During the landing...when things were at their worst...Owens was at his best. He's the one who wouldn't let the pilot dump the passenger cabin.

scene.meta: Johns blinks, stunned. "Are you shittin' me?"
Trying again, Riddick reaches out with his shiv -- and deftly slices off some of Fry's hair. A locket. A souvenir. That's all he wanted.

char.name: FRY (O.S.)
char.dialogue: So now you know.

char.name: JOHNS (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Fuck. Guess I'm more glad to be here than I thought.

scene.meta: Riddick watches them move off -- then looks at the scotch bottle, left behind. It's still got one good swallow.
Leaving the boneyard, the scouting party reaches a cleft in the hills. Ahead is a canyon.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Hold up.

scene.meta: He jumps onto a rock, puts the scope to an eye.

char.name: JOHNS (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: Didn't bite.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: What?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Thought he might be coolin' it in the boneyard -- could either double-back to the ship or slip in behind us. So I left the bottle out as bait.

scene.meta: SCOPE POV: PANNING the boneyard. FINDING the bottle. It's still got that one swallow.

char.name: JOHNS (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: But nah. Didn't bite.

scene.meta: CLOSER on the bottle. Only we see that the scotch has been emptied -- and replaced with sand.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. GRAVE SITE - SPIRED HILLS - DAY
scene.meta: Working under the shade of a tarp, Zeke digs a communal grave. Three wrapped corpses wait nearby. He keeps a sight-line on... The crash ship. Shazza waves. Zeke waves back.

The scouting party transits a narrowing canyon. Lined with rib bones, it makes us feel like we're in the belly of some beast. Fry squints at the ridgetops. More of those spires are visible on the canyon rims, looming like silent sentinels. "What are they? Just mineral deposits?"

char.name: PILGRIM #1
char.dialogue: Captain...captain....

scene.meta: The Chrislams have found what appears to be a small desert plant. Leathery petals are spread wide, revealing a round stringy core. ARABIC DISCUSSION. Desert fruit? Is it edible?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Wait, wait, wait....

scene.meta: Fry takes the "plant," pushes the "petals" back down over the core. They all stare. It's a baseball.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: We are not alone here, yes?

scene.meta: They look ahead, wondering what awaits them. But Johns is looking back.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Never thought we were.

scene.meta: HIGH ANGLE: An old WEATHER COCK CREAKS in the wind. Fry, Johns, and the Chrislams enter FRAME far below.

char.name: PILGRIM #1
char.dialogue: Assalamoo ahlaykum!

scene.meta: The GREETING ECHOES through the settlement, built from stacked shipping containers. Tattered sun-shades flap in the wind. A rusty bike lies on the ground.

char.name: PILGRIM #2
char.dialogue: Assalamoo ahlaykum!

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Long gone. Whoever they were.

scene.meta: They move around a building -- and pull up short. Before them looms a moisture-recovery unit, a hulking machine in disrepair. Old jugs litter the ground.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Water...water there was here....

char.name: PILGRIMS
char.dialogue: Allahu Akbar....

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: (translating) "God is Great," yes?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: I'm born-again.

scene.meta: Fry manages a weary smile -- but soon her eyes revisit the abandoned buildings. "Who were these people? Why did they leave so much behind?"

Through a window, we see the Johns and the Chrislams crawling over the moisture-recovery unit, assessing repairs. PULL BACK to include Fry inside the settlement, inspecting... Refectory table. Place settings out. Years of dust. Photos on the wall: Settlers working modest gardens. Playing baseball. Posing with children.
Fry enters a dark room.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Lights.

scene.meta: No response to her command. She pats around for old-style wall switches. Nothing. Perceiving black-out blinds on a window, she throws them open to reveal... A man standing right outside.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: (through window) Hey. Don't go too far, huh?

scene.meta: Fry nods. Johns smiles, leaves. Just as her heart settles, SOMETHING CREAKS behind her. It's an orrery, a mechanical device that shows the motion of the planets around their suns. Solar powered, the orrery starts turning, CREAKING. One planet seems always to have sunlight.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: No darkness. No lights because no darkness....

scene.meta: Fry reaches a porch. It looks out over the rear of the settlement and more unforgiving terrain. She starts back inside -- but something glints at the edge of her vision. Fry turns back...parts clothes on a laundry line...and sees the source of the glint. Excited hits on her breather. Fry vaults off the porch -- and starts walking as if on magnetic bearing. Soon she's running.

char.name: FRY (V.O.)
char.dialogue: Allahu Akbar! Allahu Akbar!

scene.meta: Johns and the Chrislams trade looks.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Allahu Akbar!

scene.meta: Fry stops on a groomed runway, out of breath. The others catch up. They too marvel at... The skiff, a light-duty vehicle of hybrid technology -- part bush plane, part space craft. Its fabric wings are wind-torn -- but the hull looks intact.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. TOP OF CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: CLOSE on caviar being added to toast-points. A SCRABBLING SOUND stops Paris in mid-bite. He eases out of his rocker, moves to the rear edge of the ship and looks down on... A shadow ducking under him. Small rocks still trickle down a dirt rampart just climbed by...someone.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: This now qualifies as the worst fun I've ever had. Stop it.

scene.meta: No response.
War-pick in hand, Paris eases to ground-level. He checks the perimeter, looks inside the ship. Nobody. Is he being fucked with? Again? He hopes?

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Audrey? Oh, Audrey....

char.name: AUDREY (O.S.)
char.dialogue: What?

scene.meta: Paris spins. The voice came from the cargo hold -- and not where he expected.
Blades of sunlight stream in through cracks in the hull. Paris enters to find Shazza and Audrey cutting open containers, searching for usable goods.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Tell me that was you.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Okay, it was me. What'd I do now?

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Assailing my fragile sense of security, that's what.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: What're you goin' on about? She's been right here for the last....

scene.meta: They all see it: Sun-blades are momentarily blocked by something passing outside. Someone.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: (a quiet probe) Zeke?

scene.meta: No answer. Audrey springs to the other side of hold, puts an eye to a crack there. HULL-CRACK POV: Far away, Zeke finishes digging the grave. He starts toward the ship. Audrey whirls back, mouths a silent alarm: "RIDDICK!" Paris goes bloodless. Shazza grabs the war-pick out of his frozen hands, moves catlike to the main doors and poises there, ready to strike. Audrey follows with the hunting boomerang. All eyes watch as... The sun-blades, winking off and on, chart Riddick's approach: We feel like we're inside a magician's sword box, watching the blades shave closer and closer to us. Suddenly he appears... And Shazza swings hard.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: No!

scene.meta: Facing them is a TOTAL STRANGER -- burned, half naked, one hand still clutching the emergency-release lever of his cryo-locker. Shazza stopped one inch short of killing him.

char.name: TOTAL STRANGER
char.dialogue: I thought...my God, I thought I was the only one who....

scene.meta: He lurches toward Shazza, trying to embrace her -- and sees blood and brain-bits BLAM-BLAMMING against her. His own. The stranger sinks bonelessly to the ground. FAST RACK to reveal Zeke in the background, pistol leveled. He reads Shazza's horrified face -- and understands what he's done.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Oh, Lord....

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: It was just somebody else. From the crash. He was just....

char.name: ZEKE
char.dialogue: Cripes galore, I thought it was him. The murderin' ratbag. I thought he was....

scene.meta: He rushes over to check the dead stranger. As he bends down, FAST RACK AGAIN to reveal Riddick in the background. He stands 20 paces off, still unseen by the others. His goggle eyes covet... Zeke's breather.
Fry exits the skiff.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: No juice, looks like it's been laid up for years. But we might be able to adapt --

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Shut up.

scene.meta: Outside, Johns has an ear cocked to the wind.

char.name: JOHNS (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: Sorry. Thought I heard something.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Like what?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Like my pistola.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. GRAVE SITE - SPIRED HILLS - DAY
scene.meta: START on the drag-sled carrying Corpse #4-- the stranger. Zeke reaches the grave. The sun-tarp has fallen on one side, blocking the sight-line between ship and grave. Zeke starts to unload the body -- but sees something he didn't notice before: There's some kind of opening at the bottom of the grave.

char.name: ZEKE
char.dialogue: Now what the bloody hell....

scene.meta: Zeke hops down into the grave. CAMERA MOVES to reveal Riddick hidden among the spires. He's been waiting for a chance just like this.

Zeke drops to all fours. Looks into the tunnel. There seems to be some kind of burrow beyond. BURROW POV: Staring back at Zeke. Zeke takes a handlight off his belt, shines it into the burrow. It's the last thing he ever does.
As MORE GUNSHOTS jar Paris, Audrey, Shazza.
FURIOUS CLOSEUPS: Zeke fighting for his life. PISTOL BLASTING. Something slashing at him. Blood dancing on air.
Shazza sprints across hard-pack, heading for...

scene.sceneheader: EXT. GRAVE SITE - SPIRED HILLS - DAY
scene.meta: The grave. She slaps aside the tarp to find... Riddick. Bone-shiv in hand, he just stands on the other side of the grave. Shazza looks down. And SCREAMS.

CAMERA PURSUES Riddick as he lopes through the spires, running from the scene of the crime. He turns a blind corner -- and SOMETHING NEARLY BLOWS HIS HEAD OFF at close range. He hits ground. A boot steps on his neck, keeping him there.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Same crap, different planet, huh?

scene.meta: Sucking on their breathers, Fry and the Chrislams make it back to the ship. They find Johns beating Riddick like a chained dog.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: ...I don't play that...I don't play that so just try again. C'mon, Riddick, tell me a better lie....

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Ease up, ease up. JOHNS! Just tell me what....

scene.meta: She hauls him off -- only to have Shazza start punching Riddick.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: What'd you do with 'im? You bloody sick animal you, what'dja do with me Zeke?

scene.sceneheader: EXT. GRAVE SITE - SPIRED HILLS - DAY
scene.meta: Fry and Johns stand over the grave. It's a gory mess -- but no sign of Zeke. Johns has Riddick's confiscated shiv.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: He used that?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Sir Shiv-a-lot. He likes to cut.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: So why isn't it all bloody?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: I assume he licked it clean.

scene.sceneheader: INT. MAIN CABIN - CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: Riddick is back in chains, face pulpy from the beating, listening to SOTTO VOCE VOICES outside. Fry enters, looks at him hard.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: So where is he?

scene.meta: Riddick turns away, revealing a broken goggle-lens. The eye beneath is closed: For some reason, he won't look at her.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Tell me about the sounds. You told them you heard something right before.... (no response) If you don't talk to me, Johns'll take another crack at it -- at your skull.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: 'Mean the whispers?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: What whispers?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: The ones tellin' me to go for the sweet spot -- just to the left of the spine, fourth lumbar down. The abdominal aorta. What a gusher. Had a cup on his belt, so I used it to catch a little run-off. Metallic taste to it, human blood. Coppery. But if you cut it with peppermint schnapps, that goes away. Course, that's more for winter. Summertime, I take mine straight.

scene.meta: Fry stares. Riddick gets a black satisfaction from his role as Boogeyman: If fear is the only kind of respect he can get, Riddick is going to grab some with both hands.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Why don't we try the truth now?

scene.meta: A head-shaking beat, then:

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: All you people are so scared of me -- an' most days, I'd take that as a compliment -- but it ain't me you gotta worry about now.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Show me your eyes.

scene.meta: Again he turns away. She strips the goggles off. He sits with lids shut tight, anticipating the pain.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Show me, Riddick.

scene.meta: Imagine a virgin undressing in front of someone for the first time. That's how Riddick opens his eyes, startling us: No irises, just huge black-pool pupils. And from deep within, a jewel-like eyeshine. His eyes are as beautiful and unsettling as those of a starved jaguar.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: You did this? To yourself?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Slam doctor. Well, we called him "doctor."

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Heard about it. Just never seen it.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Fairly fuckin' ironic, wouldn't you say? Slamlight's so dim that you go and get your eyeballs taken out and shined up -- then you wind up here. Three ass-kick suns. (replacing goggles) Maybe I did do a few people. But not this one. No ma'am, not this time.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Then where is he? He's not in the hole. We looked.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Look deeper.

scene.meta: He CLICKS HIS TONGUE at her.
Chain looped over one shoulder, Fry heads back to the grave site. Johns, Imam, Shazza, and Audrey keep pace as...

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: I know what happened -- he went off on the guy, buried him on the hill somewhere, and now he's trying to --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Let's just be sure.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: I am sure. Look, murders aside, Riddick belongs in the Asshole Hall of Fame. He loves the jaw-jackin', loves making you afraid, 'cuz that's all he has. And you're playing right into --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: We're gonna find the body, Johns. Christ, you're a cop. Why am I tellin' you this? We gotta go down and find it.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Well, don't ask me to.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Thought you didn't believe his story.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: I don't. But that ground looked none too stable, and I don't want anyone --

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: If you're afraid, I'll go.

scene.meta: He shoots Audrey a scowl.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Nobody else is going down but me, okay?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: (pulling her aside) Hey. Bein' ballsy with your life now doesn't change what came before -- it's just stupid.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: What, you think I'm doin' this to prove something?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: You said it, not me. Let's just not let one bad call lead to another.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Thanks for the tip, Johns.

scene.meta: "Now get outta my way."
Chain hooked to her web belt, Fry drops into the grave. She peers into the burrow...looks back up at the halo of faces above her...then slithers out of sight.
Letting her eyes adjust, Fry pats around lightly. Quickly she finds Zeke's handlight, tries it. Broken.
CLOSE on the chain slithering through hands, playing out as Fry moves deeper underground.
Fry makes an uphill turn. Sees a spray of light ahead. Worms forward to reach...

Another chamber, wide and just large enough to stand in. Shafts of daylight bore down into the room. More old bones litter the floor. Fry moves into one shaft and looks up at... An earthen funnel. The inside of a spire.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: They're hollow....

char.name: CLICK-CLICK.
char.dialogue: Fry slow-turns toward the sound.

char.name: CLICK-CLICK-CLICK.
char.dialogue: There's something here, something just beyond the cusp of light. Something unfolding.

scene.meta: An icy hand grips her heart. Soundlessly, Fry backtracks her chain, but... Something shadows across the exit. It stops her cold. Her hand finds something new. She angles it to the light. It's one of Zeke's boots -- with a bit of Zeke still in it.

char.name: CLICKITY-CLICKITY-CLICKITY....
char.dialogue: The whole chamber is coming alive around her, shadows unfurling, skulking the perimeter, circling.

scene.meta: Something impales the boot out of her hand, reclaiming it. It was faster than a lightning-strike. A paralyzed beat before... Fry makes her move, rolling back into the shaft of daylight and springing straight up into...
The spire. Bracing against the walls, Fry tries to "walk" her way up -- but her chain goes taut. Did it catch on something? Or did something catch it? Fry starts pounding the earthen walls.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Here! I'm in HERE, HERE, HERE!

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Did you hear....

scene.meta: They drop down and suspend their heads over the bloody grave, listening. Nothing now.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I'm over here in the --

scene.meta: Something tugs on her chain.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Oh, God....

scene.meta: CLOSE on her feet. Kicking hard at the walls, trying to gouge out footholds. A stronger tug. Fry loses altitude, slipping closer to... The MADLY CLICKING LAIR below. She tries to jettison her belt -- but can't brace herself up and undo the belt. Suddenly... Something explodes near her head. Daylight appears, followed by faces, human faces. They're breaking through the spire with the pick-ax. Hands reach inside...
...and birth her into daylight. Overlapping:

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: We got you...it's okay, it's okay...we got you now....

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: The child heard you before any of us could even....

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Did you find him? You find Zeke?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (half insane) ...wasn't Riddick...it was...it was... goddamn, that was stupid....but wasn't Riddick. Somethin' else down there that got Zeke and nearly got --

scene.meta: Her. She flies back into the spire. Something's still got the chain. The others grab at flailing limbs. It's a tug-of-war now, human hands on one end, unseen "hands" on the other -- and the humans are losing. Until... Imam unsheathes his blade... And slices through Fry's belt.
As the chain falls down the spire. Without Fry.
FAST SHOTS: Survivors packing up O2, liquor, umbrellas, the Koran -- whatever qualifies as "essential" on this planet. Amid the activity, Audrey pauses to look at... The spired hills.

scene.sceneheader: INT. BATTERY BAY - CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: Fry and Imam pull a power cell from the ship's battery bay, THUMPING it down on the deck.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: One is all?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: For now.

scene.meta: At his personal locker, Johns digs out a box of shotgun shells. He bypasses the blue-metal shells for a red-metal one. There's something special about it -- though what, we can't be sure.

scene.sceneheader: INT. MAIN CABIN - CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: A shadow falls over Riddick. He doesn't look up.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Found somethin' worse than me, huh?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: We're movin'. And I'm just wondering if I shouldn't lighten the load right now.

scene.meta: Now their eyes meet. Johns RATCHETS HIS SHOTGUN and points it at Riddick's head.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Woof, woof.

scene.meta: The SHOTGUN EXPLODES. CAMERA PANS off of Johns to show Riddick still alive. The shotgun discharged next to his head and blew off his wrist chains.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Want you to remember this moment, Riddick. The way it coulda gone and didn't.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (deaf) Say that again.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Here's the deal. You work without the chains, without the bit -- without the shivs. You help us get off this rock....

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: For what? The honor of goin' back to some asshole of a cell?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Truth is, Riddick, I'm tired of this head-up shit. I wanna be free of you as much as you wanna be free of me.

scene.meta: A beat. The future rearranges in Riddick's head.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: You'd cut me loose, Boss?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Only if we both get outta this alive. And there may be a way.

scene.meta: He offers a hand to help Riddick up, to seal the deal.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (staring at hand) My recommendation: Do me. Don't take the chance that I'll get shiv-happy on your wannabe ass. Ghost me, Riddick. Would if I were you.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: If you were me, I'd kill us both. C'mon, you wanna sit at the grown-up table or not?

scene.meta: A beat. Riddick reaches out for the hand -- and grabs the shotgun with his off-hand. A blur of movement. Suddenly Johns is staring at the eyes of his own shotgun.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Want you to remember this moment.

scene.meta: He pumps shotgun, spitting blue shells over Johns. He drops the emptied gun and walks away.

EXTREMELY WIDE: Blue sun setting, yellow and red sun rising. The survivors trek for the settlement. Fry and Imam lug the power cell between them, but the real load is shouldered by... Riddick. Promoted from murderous monster to beast of burden, he tows a drag-sled heavy with cargo.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: (to Johns) So just like that. Wave your little wand and he's one of us now.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Didn't say that. But least this way I don't have to worry about falling asleep and not wakin' up.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Well, I feel we owe Mr. Riddick amends.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Oh, right. Let's all line up and beg his forgiveness. Right you are.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: At least give the man some oxygen....

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: He's happy just bein' vertical. Leave him be.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: So I can talk to him now?

char.name: JOHNS/SHAZZA
char.dialogue: (in unison) No.

scene.meta: Paris drops a wine bottle. Trailing, Riddick collects it.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Paris P. Ogilvie. Antiquities dealer, entrepreneur.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (shaking hands) Richard B. Riddick. Escaped convict, murderer.

scene.meta: Instead of returning the bottle, Riddick opens it and drinks. Paris hurries to catch up to the others.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: You know, if I owned Hell and this planet...I believe I'd rent this out and live in Hell.

scene.meta: FRY'S POV: Of spires high above us. The group falls silent as they transit the canyon, all eyes on the spires. Fry stops short, hearing...

char.name: CLICKITY-CLICK.
char.dialogue: Neck hairs rise -- but soon the sound vanishes. The group starts moving again, faster.

char.name: CLICKITY-CLICKITY-CLICK.
char.dialogue: Are they being stalked? Nervously, Fry traces the sound back to...

scene.meta: Beads dangling from the belt of Pilgrim #1. Whenever he moves, the STRINGS CLACK together.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: I mean, usually I can appreciate antiques, but, uh....

scene.meta: The survivors have reached the settlement. Fry is trying to get the power cell aboard the skiff as the others walk its exterior.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Little ratty-ass.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Nothing we can't repair -- so long as the electrical adapts.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Not a star-jumper.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Doesn't need to be. Use this to get back up to the Sol-Track Shipping Lanes, stick out a thumb. You'll get picked up. (to Fry) Right?

scene.meta: Fry looks from Riddick to Johns. "How did he know that?"

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Little help here?

scene.meta: They muscle the power cell aboard. Riddick starts to follow, but Johns blocks. He doesn't want Riddick inside.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Check those containers for me. See what we can patch wings with.

scene.meta: With religious fervor, the Chrislams are repairing the moisture- recovery unit -- the machine Allah led them to.
START on the battery bay. Hands are adapting the power cell to the skiffs older electrical system. Soon... Lights wink on throughout the ship.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Okay, that should buy us a sys-check. But we'll need more cells.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: How many?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: 15 6-gigs here...90 gigs total...other ship carries 20-gig cells, so...five. Five total to launch.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: 25 kilos each, huh?

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Old sand-cat outside. See if I can't get it up and chuggin'.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Do it. And if you need an extra hand, tap our problem child out.... (looking out) Where's Riddick?

scene.meta: He's walking the ghost town, finding dead gardens...upended chairs and furniture...broken skylights. Behind his back... Audrey and Pilgrim #3 (the youngest Chrislam) scurry through FRAME, stalking this curious monster in their midst.

CLOSE on the other Chrislams, faces charged with anticipation while awaiting... The first drop of water. It appears at the bottom of a pipette. Tongues fight for it. Another drop forms in its place. Now another and another. It brings CHEERS.
CLOSE on Paris' hands. Getting ready to celebrate, he unwraps crystal goblets...dusts off the refectory table...and rehangs an old Christmas garland. INTERCUT WITH...

Hands digging in dirt. Covertly, Audrey and Pilgrim #3 watch Riddick digging near the entrance of a tall windowless structure. He excavates a pair of broken eyeglasses... a shattered light... and a child's tin robot, timeless. Riddick thumbs a solar panel clean. The robot's language program warbles to life:

char.name: ROBOT
char.dialogue: "...to all intruders. I am the guardian of this land. I will protect my masters at all cost. Death to all intruders..."

scene.meta: Riddick stands and tries the doors. Locked. He peers through a small filthy window. Is there something moving inside? Nothing now. Riddick removes some windblown trash from a doorside sign. "Coring Room."

char.name: JOHNS (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Missin' the party. C'mon.

scene.meta: It's Johns, keeping him on a short leash. Leaving, Riddick kicks a trash bin. Hard.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Missin' the party. C'mon.

scene.meta: He leaves. HOLD on the trash bin a beat.

char.name: AUDREY (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Talkin' to me?

scene.meta: PILGRIM'S POV: Of Audrey exiting the trash bin and running after Riddick and Johns. Pilgrim #3 is at the window of the coring room. He's found a way inside. By the window's feeble light, he starts exploring. Just visible at the center of this room is a vertical coring drill.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: ...and for this, our gift of drink, we give thanks in the name of our Prophet, Muhammad, peace be upon him, and to our Lord, Jesus Christ of Nazareth, and to his father, Allah the Compassionate and the Merciful.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: (to himself) The strangest religion....

scene.meta: Pilgrims finish pouring cloudy water into goblets. Riddick gets the last of it -- the part with sediment. SELECTED CLOSEUPS as they drink. Nothing ever tasted finer.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Perhaps we should toast our hosts. Who were these people, anyway? Miners?

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Looks like geologists. Advance team, moves around from rock to rock.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Musta crapped out here, huh?

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: But why did they leave their ship?

scene.meta: Silence. It's a question no one has chosen to deal with yet. Imam notices one water glass unspoken for.
CLOSE on the "Coring Room" sign. An attached solar panel begins moving, orienting toward sunlight. When it catches the full brunt of the suns' rays... STORM SHUTTERS unlatch on the roof.
Pilgrim #3 hears SHOOTING LATCHES overhead. That sound brings another sound: A strange SKITTERING. The pilgrim looks up. Is there something in the rafters?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: (answering Audrey) Well, just a skiff. Disposable, really.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Like an emergency life-raft, right?

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Sure. Coulda had a real drop-ship take them off-planet. Long gone.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: A toast to their ghosts, then....

scene.meta: Goblets rise.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Didn't leave, these people. Whatever got Zeke got them. They're all dead.

scene.meta: It's like he just pissed in the punchbowl.

char.name: RIDDICK (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: What, you don't really think they left with their clothes on the lines? Photos on the walls?

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Maybe they had weight limits, you don't know.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: I know you don't uncrate your emergency ship unless there's a fucking emergency.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Rag it, Riddick. Nobody wants your theories on --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (to Riddick) So what happened? Where are they, then?

scene.meta: Fry is the only one willing to look at reality -- or at least glance its way. At the window, Imam scans outside.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Has anyone seen the young one? Ali?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (to Fry and Imam) Has anyone checked the coring room?

scene.meta: Now the storm shutters start yawning open, spreading daylight over Pilgrim #3 and... The ceiling rafters. They're encrusted with thick nests of... something. The SKITTERING grows louder, more agitated. Sensing trouble, Pilgrim #3 hurries for a sliver of daylight in a wall -- the breach he entered through. He never gets there: Sunlight hits the first nest. It EXPLODES WITH LIFE.
As Imam hears the SCREAM.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Ali....

scene.meta: CHAOTIC SHOTS: More NESTS EXPLODE into individual creatures, winged hatchlings moving like bats in a fire, talons hacking and slashing. His exit blocked, Pilgrim #3 veers into... A dark supply room. He slams the door, MUMBLES A BLESSING and waits for the storm to pass. He's been cut -- but at least he's still alive.
As the survivors run for the coring room.
As Riddick stays behind to drink their water.
HINGES ARE BLASTED AWAY. The door caves in. Imam shoulders past Johns to enter and find... The empty coring room.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Ali?

scene.meta: A NOISE from the supply room. Is it Ali? Just too scared to come out? Imam opens the door... And hatchlings pour out. Moving with a gang-intelligence, they circle the room in a wave, soar high into the rafters -- then plunge into the coring shaft, SQUEALS VANISHING to infinity. Shocked silence, then... Pilgrim #3 tumbles to the ground. He's been shredded into bloody kite-tails. There was a nest inside the supply room. Imam falls on him in grief. Johns and Fry inch forward to peer down... The coring shaft. It's littered with human bones. The skeletons of the settlers. Scattered about and picked clean.
Against a blue sunrise, the Chrislams hold a prayer service. Paris and Audrey attend. Riddick watches from afar.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Why was the door chained up? Why the bloody hell would they lock themselves in like that?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Not sure, but tell you what: Chrislams better not be diggin' another grave out there.

char.name: RIDDICK (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Other buildings weren't secure...

scene.meta: They turn. Riddick enters.

char.name: RIDDICK (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: ...so they ran here. Heaviest doors. Thought they'd be safe inside, but... (looks down shaft) Someone forget to lock the back door.

scene.meta: Shazza joins him at the shaft. Gazing on the human remains:

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: So that's what come of me Zeke. An' you saw it. You was right there.

scene.meta: Riddick nods.

char.name: SHAZZA (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: You were tryin' to kill him too.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (shrugging, "not necessarily") Just wanted his O-2. (a beat) Though I notice he tried to ghost my ass. When he shot up that stranger instead.

scene.meta: Shazza can't deny it. She looks at him differently now, the man she once beat while in chains. She takes off her breather.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Take it.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (suspicious) What, it's broken?

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Startin' to acclimate, anyhow. Take it.

scene.meta: Riddick accepts it awkwardly, sucks down some pure O2. Johns watches the exchange closely, not much liking the idea of Riddick being promoted to oxygen-breathing human.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: (to Fry) Let's board this up and get the hell gone. They seem to stick to the dark, so if we stick to daylight, should be all --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: 60 years ago.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Wha'?

scene.meta: Coring samples line the room, laid out on counters. Fry's been scrutinizing them.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Core-samples are dated. Last one is 60 years ago. This month.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: Yeah? What's special about that?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Dunno. Maybe nothing, but....

scene.meta: But now Fry remembers...

The orrery. The year-counter clicks over to "45" as... Fry opens the drive box and starts turning the main gear, accelerating the orbits. CLOSE on the counter. "56...57...58...59...60." They all see it: A giant ringed world eclipses the suns and plunges their planet into darkness. Persistent darkness.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Are you fuckin' kidding me?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Not afraid of the dark, are you?

scene.meta: Crossing the yard in wide strides:

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: ...need those cells from the crash ship. Shit, still gotta check out the hull, patch the wings --

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Let's wait on the power cells.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Wait for what? Until it's so dark we can't even find our way back to --

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: We're not sure when it happens, so let's not --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Get the fucking cells over here, Johns. What's the discussion?

scene.meta: A beat.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Ever tell you how Riddick escaped?

scene.meta: Alone inside the skiff, Johns and Fry continue with more privacy.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (jarred) He can pilot?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Hijacked a prison transport, made a helluva good run 'fore I tracked him down.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (with faint hope) Okay, maybe that's a good thing. Maybe I can use him to help with --

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: He also figured out how to kill the pilot, Fry.

scene.meta: A mental shiver.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: You said we were going to trust him now. You said there was a deal.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: That's what I said.

scene.meta: He challenges her to read his mind.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Oh, this is a dangerous game you're playing, Johns.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: May've noticed chains don't work on this guy. Only way we're truly safe is if he believes he's goin' free. But if he stops believin' --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: You mean, if he learns that you're gonna royally fuck him over.

char.name: JOHNS (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: -- we need a fail-safe. Bring the cells over at the last possible minute -- when the wings are ready, when we know we're ready to launch.

scene.meta: Fry looks at him with new eyes.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: You know, he hasn't harmed any of us. Far as I can tell, he hasn't even lied to us. Just stick to the deal, Johns. Let him go if that's what it --

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: He's a murderer. The law says he's gotta do his bid.

scene.meta: Shaking her head, she looks off.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Dancin' on razor blades here...

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: I won't give him a chance to grab another ship -- or to slash another pilot's throat.

scene.meta: Johns descends the gangway -- and finds Riddick erecting a field table in the shade of the skiff. He seems out of earshot. Now, anyway. As they trade looks, another flu-like shiver runs through Johns.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Bad sign. Shakin' like that in this heat.

scene.meta: Johns moves on. The Chrislams appear, shouldering a roll of Vectran (wing-fabric material). They drop it on the table. Ready to cut bindings, Imam pats his hip for the knife that was just there.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (looking after Johns) I'll cut.

scene.meta: He has the knife.
As Shazza and Audrey repair the sand-cat.

CLOSE on the knife slicing through the Vectran. Riddick hands the trim to Pilgrim #1. CAMERA FOLLOWS as he scampers onto the skiff...balance-beams over wing-struts...and delivers the piece to Imam, who stitches the fabric like an old Berber rug-weaver. Pilgrim #1 pauses to check on... The setting blue sun. Nothing unusual. Yet.
The hatch closes, seals. CLOSE on a monitor. A "HULL INTEGRITY TEST" is underway. Fry scans rising pressure gauges.

char.name: RIDDICK (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Looks like we're a few shy....

scene.meta: Fry whirls. Riddick is aboard, staring at the depleted battery bay. And he has Imam's blade.

char.name: RIDDICK (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: Power cells.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: They're coming.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Strange, not doin' a run-up on the main drive yet. (half-beat) Strange unless he told you the particulars of my escape.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I got the quick-and-ugly version.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: An' now you're worried about a repeat of history?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Entered our minds.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: I asked what you thought.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: You scare me, Riddick. That's what you wanna hear, isn't it? There, I admit it, Can I get back to work now?

scene.meta: She finds the courage to turn her back on him. Riddick moves closer -- and takes a beat to scan the controls. The cabin pressure builds.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Think Johns is an do-right man? You think I can trust him to cut me loose?

scene.meta: A beat. Does Riddick already know? Is he testing her?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Why, what'd you hear?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Well, guess if it was trickeration he'd just do me, huh? Then again...I am worth twice as much alive. (reading her face) Didn't know? Johns ain't a cop. Oh, he's got that shiny badge an' all, but nah -- he's just a merc and I'm just a payday. That's why he won't kill me. The creed is greed.

scene.meta: It knocks her off stride, but...

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Save it, Riddick. We aren't gonna turn on each other -- no matter how hard you try.

scene.meta: Riddick moves right up behind her.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: I don't truly know what's gonna happen when the lights go out, Carolyn -- but I do know that once the dyin' starts, this little psycho family of ours is gonna rip itself apart. So you better find out the truth. Come nightfall, you better know exactly who's standing behind you.

scene.meta: A monitor chirps the news: "HULL INTEGRITY --100%." EXHALING GASSES, the hatch opens automatically.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Oh, ask him 'bout those shakes. And ask why your crew-pal had to scream like that 'fore he died.

scene.meta: CLOSEUPS: Hands select a red-metal shotgun shell from a box... pull the shell open...remove a glass ampule hidden inside...drop the ampule into a injection syringe. The syringe touches an eager arm vein.

char.name: FRY (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Who are you? Really?

scene.meta: Shirt off, Johns looks up. She's in the doorway.

char.name: FRY (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: You're not a real cop, are you? Just some mercenary who goes around talkin' about the law like --

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: I never said I was.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Never said you were a hype, either.

scene.meta: She moves closer. Rummages through his stuff brazenly. Finds a shitload of red shells with the hidden ampules.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: You have a little caffeine in the morning, I have a little morphine. So what?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: And here you got two mornings every day. Wow, were you born lucky?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Not a problem unless you're gonna make --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (lashing) You made it a problem when you let Owens die like that. When you had enough drugs to knock out a fucking mule-team.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Owens was already dead. His brain just hadn't caught on to that fact.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Anything else we should know about you, Johns? Christ, here I am lettin' you play games with our lives when --

scene.meta: He catches her hands -- and moves them around his body, forcing her into an embrace. We understand why when we see a CLOSEUP of her hands: They find a jagged purple scar beside his spine.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: My first run-in with Riddick. Went for the sweet-spot and missed. They had to leave a piece of the shiv in there. I can feel it, sometimes, pressing against the cord. (giving her hands back) So maybe the care and feeding of my nerve-endings is my business.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: You coulda helped. And you didn't.

scene.meta: O.S., we hear the Chrislams JABBERING ARABIC and calling for "Captain, Captain...."

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Yeah, well, look to thine own ass first. Right, "captain"?

scene.meta: It cuts deep.
Fry and Johns move outside. The others have gathered, all eyes gang-locked on... An arch in the sky. Luminous, ominous, it grows from the horizon.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: What do my eyes see?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: It's starting....

scene.meta: They watch hypnotically as the arch rises, inching toward the two suns. Shazza shakes out of the trance first.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: (to Fry) If we need anything from the crash ship -- I suggest we kick on. That sand-cat's solar.

scene.meta: MULTIPLE SHOTS: Shazza cranking the sand-cat...hands snatching up lights, water, ropes...Chrislams piling aboard the sand-cat.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: LET'S GET THOSE CELLS!

scene.meta: Sand-cat moving...Riddick jumping onto the rear bed....Paris and Audrey running, catching up.

char.name: SHAZZA
char.dialogue: We stay together! C'mon!

scene.meta: Johns doubles back, grabs his shotgun shells, swings out the door...
...and catches up to the sand-cat. Riddick reels him aboard.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Don't wanna miss this.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Lookit. Lookit!

scene.meta: They turn back to see the rim of a giant planet. It's cresting over the horizon. The luminous arch is the planet's rings.
The sand-cat storms through the canyon. As it passes through the massive ribcage... The ROLL CAGE SMASHES OUT some low-bridge bones.
The sand-cat reaches the crash ship. Bodies leap off. Paris steals a look at... The rising planet. It threatens to blot out suns, sky, universe.

scene.sceneheader: INT. BATTERY BAY - CRASH SHIP - DAY
scene.meta: Johns yanks the first power cell and starts dragging it over the deck. Riddick yanks a second cell and, carrying it on his shoulder, passes Johns with a suck-my-ass grin. Johns shoulders his cell and stumbles after.

Shazza wheels the sand-cat around, getting clearance between it and the ship. The Chrislams lash a scrap-metal sled to the sand-cat. Riddick drops the first cell onto the sled, Johns the second. They're racing the eclipse and each other.
As the rings of the planet eclipse the yellow sun.
It's like God just closed a blind: Daylight dims. The change in light brings a GROWING HIGH-PITCHED SOUND.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Don't stop, don't stop....

scene.meta: But Paris can't help himself. He squints to see...
The spires. THE SOUND seems to come from there.
As the rings eclipse the red sun.
A second darkness sweeps over the survivors. Now they all stop, beholding...

Something pouring from the spire-tops. Backlit by coronal light, it first seems to be smoke or ash -- but soon we realize these are living things, HATCHLINGS SQUEALING IN DELIGHT over their first nightfall.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Jesus, how many can there....

scene.meta: They keep coming, filling the sky with thick waves. Mercifully, the hatchlings seem to be moving away. But now one wave cleaves from another -- and does a quick about-face.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Just a suggestion, but perhaps we should flee.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Cargo hold, everyone in the cargo hold. lesgo, lesgo, lesgo.

scene.meta: They run. Reach the cargo hold. Turn back to see... Riddick and Shazza still coming. Hearing the SQUEALING WAVE descending on them... Riddick and Shazza hit to the dirt. Hatchlings torrent just inches overhead. CLOSE on Shazza. Horrified. Hard to breathe. Like being underwater. CLOSE on Riddick. He watches in awe, no more frightened that a kid lying on his back looking up at the stars. Experimenting, he eases a bone-shiv into the hatchlings. Instantly it's whittled down to nothing. It's like a river of razor blades. The hatchling keep coming. Shazza whips a panicky look at the cargo hold. Can she make it? Should she even try?

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Tell her to stay there. Stay down. SHAZZA, JUST STAY DOWN!

scene.meta: Shazza starts worming toward the cargo hold. Suddenly the hatchings vanish. A beat. Is it safe? Shazza gets to her feet...

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: No, no, NO, NO, NO....

scene.meta: ...and the wave is back, enveloping Shazza.
Standing in the mouth of the cargo container, the others get a last glimpse of Shazza as she flies by the doors, caught up in the funnel-cloud of hatchlings. Then she's simply gone.

Still on the ground, Riddick checks left and right like someone about to cross a busy street. Now he gets up, smacks his hands clean, strolls for the hold. Behind him... A rising GANG-CLICKING. CLOSE on Fry. She knows the sound better than anyone.
The spires are crumbling, torn down from within.

Reaching the cargo hold, Riddick turns around for one last look. PUSH IN as he sheds goggles -- and looks at the world with his jaguar eyes. RIDDICK'S POV: In degraded image, we see the predators -- adult hatchlings -- emerge from the spires. They're large, mammalian, hammer-headed. They CLICK with echo-location, sounding out the world they haven't inhabited in 60 years.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: What is it? What's happening?

scene.meta: RIDDICK'S POV: The predators launch from the hills, gliding, SOUNDING, searching.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Like I said. Ain't me you gotta worry about.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. SKY - DEEP DUSK TO NIGHT
scene.meta: The rim of the planet overtakes both suns. The world goes dark.

Vault-like DOORS BOOM CLOSED. The survivors are locked inside the only secure part of the ship. Somehow they've been reduced to neanderthals huddling in their cave, listening to the howls of the sabertooths.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: What if...what if she's still out there... still alive....

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Well, I don't want to jump to conclusions here...but 'member that boneyard? These just might be the fuckers that killed every other living thing on this planet, okay? Chances of Shazza knockin' on that door anytime soon are just about zero squared.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (agreeing) I saw the cut-marks on the bones. Wasn't a natural die-off.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Quiet, please. Everyone.

scene.meta: Imam is listening at the cargo door. The others pile up alongside, ears tuned like radar. CLICKING SWEEPS PAST outside.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: (whispering) Why do they do that? Make that sound?

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Perhaps the way they see. With sound, reflecting back.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (realizing) Echo-location. That's what it is....

scene.meta: Now MORE CLICKING -- behind them. Lights whip around to find... Nothing. Only the door of an open container about halfway down the tunnel-like hold. A volley of looks. "How the fuck could one get in here?"

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Breach in the hull. I dunno.

scene.meta: More CLICKING. Johns realizes they expect him to check it out.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: I'd rather piss glass.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Well, you got the big gauge.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Wanna rag your fat mouth?

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Maybe it's just their beads again. Imam, are you still --

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: No, no, no, I do not believe --

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: C'mon, man, you're drivin' everybody bugfuck with those things. Why don't you just lose the goddamn....

scene.meta: More CLICKING -- along with the sound of TOPPLING CARGO.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Big beads.

scene.meta: Butching up, Johns sucks on his breather and shimmies toward... The open container. Leading with his shotgun, he FIRES blindly around the door. Something SQUEALS -- then silence. Johns eases his head and a light around the door to spot... Hatchlings on the ground, blasted into dog food.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: (to others) Okay. We're okay. Just some small ones that musta --

scene.meta: Something WHOOSHES for his head, swinging like a scythe. It catches his shotgun, DISCHARGING IT, giving us... A flash-image of an adult predator. Up close. In one thin second, Johns is back with the others.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Very big beads.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Not staying in here another....

scene.meta: He goes for the main-door lever, ready to flee into the night. Fry lunges for him.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Christ, you don't know what's out there!

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: I know what's in here!

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Everybody come, this way and we should be safe. Hurry, please....

scene.sceneheader: INT. FIRST CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT
scene.meta: Imam shepherds them into a container. The door slams closed. At first, only the sound of MOUTHS SUCKING BREATHERS. Then a

char.name: SCRATCHING.
char.dialogue: Johns fumbles with a cutting torch. Gets it burning. Adjusts the gasses to illuminate...

scene.meta: The door. Scythe-like blades are probing joints. Suddenly HEAVY BLOWS drive everyone back.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (to Johns) Can you do sumpin' else with that? 'Sides holding it in my fucking face?

scene.meta: Taking the hint, Johns starts cutting the common wall between containers. It's a race between the sparks of his cutter and the blades of the predators.
