scene.sceneheader: INT. SECOND CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT
scene.meta: An burn-outline appears in the common wall. Johns kicks out the escape hatch. Audrey speed-crawls through first as...

scene.sceneheader: INT. FIRST CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT
scene.meta: Predators shred into the container right behind them, CLICKING, sweeping, hunting.

scene.sceneheader: INT. THIRD/FOURTH CONTAINERS - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT
scene.meta: SERIES OF SHOTS: Again and again, they burn a new escape hatch just as the predators break into the container being vacated, always entering darkness.

scene.sceneheader: INT. FIFTH CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT
scene.meta: Inside their fifth container now, Johns torches away. Fry and Paris use cargo to block the entrance hole -- then block the cargo with their bodies. Riddick adds his weight -- until he notices pepper-shot in the cargo. Suspecting the worst, he leaves the others behind...

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Hello, hello?

scene.meta: ...and moves to the front of the container where darkness prevails. Something SQUISHES underfoot. He slips off goggles. RIDDICK'S POV: Of dead hatchlings on the floor. This is the open container, the one where Johns found predators. Sensing energy, Riddick lifts his face. RIDDICK'S POV: Of an adolescent predator. It squats atop cargo, eating a hatchling. A heavy bone-blade crowns its skull. Sensing Riddick, it sweeps the area with INQUISITIVE CLICKS. PREDATOR POV: Of Riddick. (NOTE: The PREDATOR POV is a crude image that gives impression without detail. We're "seeing" what the predator hears with echo-location. Think of a sonagram that strobes and wraps its subject in 3-D space.) Oblivious, the others kick out the new escape hatch. Audrey, Fry, and Johns worm through. Imam and Pilgrim #2 hang back. "Where's Riddick?" He's in a stare-down with a predator. Searching, Pilgrim #2 rounds a corner -- and finds his head caught in a vice-like grip.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Don't. Move.

scene.meta: RIDDICK'S POV: As a second predator appears above them. This one reaches down with its scythe blade... And gently probes the two men. It wants know what they're made of. CLOSE on the pilgrim's shoes. Over-running with piss. More blades descend, moving over them like surgical instruments. One test-slices Riddick's shirt.

scene.sceneheader: INT. SIXTH CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT
scene.meta: In the next container, Fry waits anxiously. Hissing through the escape hatch:

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Imam? Where are they?

scene.sceneheader: INT. FIFTH CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT
scene.meta: CLOSE on a predator's scythe blade. It test-slices the pilgrim's skin. Blood wells up. All CLICKING CEASES.

char.name: IMAM (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Hasan?

char.name: FRY (O.S.)
char.dialogue: Riddick?

scene.meta: TIGHT on the pilgrim -- more scared now that the clicking has stopped. Losing his nerve, he bolts.

The predators are on him, just blurs in the dark. DEATH-SCREAM. RIDDICK'S POV: A third predator appears above him. Making his move, Riddick darts around cargo and heads for the escape hatch as... Fry's light catches him square in the face. Blinded, Riddick HOWLS and stumbles forward. Fry's light leaps deeper to hit... The predator right behind him. With a similar reaction, the beast HOWLS and flails back. HOLD on Fry for a time-stopped moment. What stopped it? Was it really her? Suddenly a SHOTGUN EXPLODES beside her head. Jacked up, Johns is BLASTING shadows.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Stop it, stop it, STOP IT!

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: 'Sokay, 'sokay. I killed it.

scene.meta: They give him a look. "Sure you did." Suddenly a CARCASS SLAMS to the floor, sending everyone jumping back in a perfect splash- pattern. "Christ, he did kill one." Fry reclaims her dropped light and beams it on the carcass. Wherever the light strikes it, the flesh chars and steams.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: There....

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Like the light is scalding it.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: It hurts them. Light actually hurts them....

scene.meta: VULTURE SOUNDS from the two O.S. adolescents, fighting over the scraps of the pilgrim.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Is that...Hasan?

scene.meta: Riddick nods.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: We'll burn a candle for him later. C'mon.

scene.sceneheader: INT. SIXTH CONTAINER - CARGO HOLD - NIGHT
scene.meta: Cargo has been shoved against the door and walls. The survivors gather around Fry's handlight. Audrey -- tough little Audrey -- has been reduced to a shivering lump of mush.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: ...one cutting torch...one handlight here, two more in the cabin...I think two more....

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Spirits. Anything over 45 proof burns well.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: How many bottles?

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Not sure. Ten?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Those umbrellas, the ones that mist. Would they burn? (reading his face) If you got a receipt?

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Possibly.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Awright. So maybe we'll have enough light.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Enough for what?

scene.meta: Now she challenges him to be the mind-reader.

char.name: JOHNS (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: Oh, lady. If you're in your right mind, I pray you go insane.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (to others) We can stick to the plan. If we get four cells back to the skiff, we're off this rock.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: I hate to kill a beautiful theory with an ugly fact, but that sand-cat won't run at night.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: We'll have to carry the cells...drag them...whatever it takes.

scene.meta: Troubled faces. Is it just our imagination? Or is the light on the floor growing dimmer?

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: You mean...tonight? With all those things still out there?

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Oh, sure. Why not? Sounds like a hoot.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Back it up. How long can this last? Few minutes? Couple hours?

scene.meta: No one knows for sure.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: I had the impression...from the model... that the two planets were moving as one. That there would be...a lasting darkness.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Those suns gotta come back sometime. And if these animals really are phobic about light, we just sit tight till then.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I'm sure that's what someone else said. Locked inside that coring room.

scene.meta: A persuasive thought. Eyes swing back to Audrey.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Look, we gotta think about everyone now -- the kid especially. How scared is she gonna be out there?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Oh, don't use her like that, for a smoke screen.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Smoke screen for what?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: For your own fear.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: (eyes narrowing) Hey. Why don't you rag your hole for two seconds and let someone else come up with a plan that doesn't involve MASS SUICIDE?

scene.meta: Two seconds pass.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: How much you weigh, Johns?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: What the hell's it matter?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: How much?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: 79 kilos.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Because you're 79 kilos of gutless white meat, and that's why you can't come up with a better plan.

scene.meta: He makes a move for her. Riddick blocks. Johns' shotgun bumps the underside of Riddick's chin.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Think about that reward, Johns.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: I'm willing to take a cut in pay.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: How 'bout a cut in your gut?

scene.meta: Johns looks down. CAMERA DROPS to reveal the shiv Riddick holds, poised for evisceration.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Oh, Trash Baby, you're gonna regret this.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Please...this solves nothing...please....

scene.meta: Johns backs off first. The light grows dimmer.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (to Audrey) They're afraid of our light. That means we don't have to be so afraid of them.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: And you're certain you can find the way back? Even in the dark?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: No, I'm not. But he can.

scene.meta: She's pointing, of course, to Riddick.
The eclipsing planet dominates half the sky. In whatever coronal light remains, we see clouds forming.

Cargo doors crack open. Mixed for maximum flame, the cutter is pushed outside and swept around. Fry appears behind it. Moving like hostages, the survivors cross open ground, trying not to heed the PRIMAL SOUNDS beyond their light. Soon they reach... The main cabin. Blackness inside.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Riddick.

scene.meta: He lifts his goggles. RIDDICK'S POV: Checking the cabin. Finding a lot of wreckage but no life.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Looks clear.

scene.meta: Johns shoulders ahead and crawls in first. Just as he stands up inside... A PREDATOR BUZZSAWS over his head, fleeing the cabin, taking off into the night.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Fuck me. You said "clear."

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Said "looks clear."

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Well, what's it look like now?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (rechecking) Looks clear.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Just get the goddamn lights on....

scene.meta: They scramble aboard. Riddick TONGUE-CLICKS behind Johns. He isn't amused.

scene.sceneheader: INT. MAIN CABIN - CRASH SHIP - NIGHT
scene.meta: PREP MONTAGE: We see the survivors powering up cabin lights... yanking three more cells from the battery bay...threading nylon cord through Paris' misting umbrellas, filling the reservoirs with high-octane liquor...swapping out O2 canisters.

scene.sceneheader: INT. MAIN CABIN - CRASH SHIP - NIGHT
scene.meta: Reloading his shotgun, Johns finds himself shaking again. He unpockets a shell -- a red morphine shell -- and gives it a lover's look. Behind him...

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Ready, Johns.

scene.meta: He palms the shell.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: He'll lead you over the first cliff. You know that, don't you?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: We're just burnin' light here.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: You give him the cells and the ship -- and he will leave you. He will leave you all out there to die.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I don't get it, Johns. What is so goddamn valuable in your life that you're worried about losing? Huh? Is there anything at all? Besides your next hype? (no response) Got no right to be so scared. Neither one of us.

scene.sceneheader: INT. BATTERY BAY - CRASH SHIP - NIGHT
scene.meta: As hands yank the last power cell.

scene.sceneheader: INT. MAIN CABIN - CRASH SHIP - NIGHT
scene.meta: Cabin lights die. Still brooding, Johns finishes loading his shotgun in the dark.

CLOSE on a burning wick. Alcohol mist shoots across the flame to create... A FIREBALL. Two umbrella torches, fabric already burned away, BELCH FIREBALLS into the night. By this light and more, we see... Imam chained into the first harness of the drag-sled. Beside him, Johns fumbles with a second harness. Hands help him into the chains. The hands belong to... Riddick. Both men recognize the irony of the prisoner helping his captor into chains.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (to all) Keep the light going. That's all we have to do to live through this. Just keep your light burning.

scene.meta: Riddick loops a handlight over his neck, places it to shine light down his back. A beacon.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (to Fry) Be runnin' about 10 paces ahead. I want light on my back -- but not in my eyes. And check your cuts. These things know our blood now.

scene.meta: CLOSE on Audrey. Overhearing, she goes stone-faced.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Riddick...was thinkin' we should make some kind of deal. Just in case, you know, this actually --

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (shaking head) Had it with deals.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: But I just wanted to say --

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Nobody's gonna turn a murderer loose. I fuckin' knew better.

scene.meta: It worries Fry. "If he doesn't expect to go free...."

char.name: RIDDICK (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: Been a long time since anyone's trusted me. That's somethin' right there.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: We can, can't we? Trust you?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Actually... (completely genuine) That's what I been askin' myself.

scene.meta: He walks away. HOLD on Fry -- wondering if she hasn't made a terrible, terrible mistake.

The drag-sled begins moving. SERIES OF TRACKING SHOTS: Riddick running point, goggles off, eyes flashing. Johns and Imam pulling the drag-sled like malamutes, handlights sweeping. Pilgrims #1 at the first side- guard position, Fry and Audrey at the second, each position carrying an umbrella torch, FIREBALLS BLAZING. Paris stumbling along at rear-point, sweeping the cutter back and forth, every shadow a threat. They are a train of light. CLOSE on the sled. Holding four power cells and eight bottles of booze. CLOSE on Fry. Looking down. Noting sand-cat tracks underfoot.

Below us run the survivors. CRANE UP AND AWAY so that their lights become insignificant...so that we include, in FOREGROUND, the silhouettes of gliding predators. They're following from above, awaiting their chance.
FRY'S POV: Of the ground. The sand-cat tracks have vanished.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: So you noticed too?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Riddick. Riddick.

scene.meta: The procession grinds to a halt. Everyone sucks hard on breathers as they muster inside the light.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Where are the sand-cat tracks? Why aren't we still following them?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Saw something I didn't like.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Such as.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Hard to tell, sometimes...even for me... but looked like a bunch of those big boys chewin' each other's gonads off. Thought we'd swing wide. Okay by you?

scene.meta: Paris looks over his shoulder. "We went around what?" Nearby CLICKING breaks up the confrontation.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Let's move. (to Audrey) Just a detour. He'll get us there.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Can we switch?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: What, switch what?

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: I think I twisted my ankle running backwards like that. And I'm not sure I can.... (off their stares) Okay, that's a lie. I just don't want to be alone back there anymore. If you could just give me a few minutes up front here --

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: She's the pilot, she should stay close to the cells.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Oh, so I'm disposable?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I'll switch, I'll switch! Christ, just get this train moving!

scene.meta: They trundle on, Fry the new tail-gunner. At side guard, Paris relaxes a bit -- even though the CLICKING never seems far from earshot. A weak FIREBALL SPEWS from his torch. He checks the reservoir. Almost empty.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Light, please, need light here....

scene.meta: Still moving, Johns and Imam train lights on Paris while he refuels. For a brief moment, Audrey strays from the light. PREDATOR'S POV: Dive-bombing the girl. A HIGH-VELOCITY CLICKING: It's like an incoming missile. Imam lunges at the last nanosecond... And flattens Audrey to the ground. Scythe blades swing... CHINKING the harness-chains on Imam's back. Johns whirls, BLASTS. Light-beams leap around. But the predator is long gone.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: (trembling) Please...have we been cut? Can someone tell me if....

scene.meta: He finds his dropped light, thumbs the switch again and again. Broken. In the confusion, Paris has been left in the dark. Something slashes him from behind. It's like the night has claws.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Oh, sweet Jesus....

scene.meta: The bottle drops. The blood flows. The CLICKING STOPS.

char.name: PARIS
char.dialogue: Oh, sweet Jesus, WILL YOU GET ME SOME LIGHT OVER HERE!

scene.meta: Faces whip around. But before their lights can rescue him... Paris is gone, snatched away by a swooping blur. Light-beams jump fitfully, vainly. RIDDICK'S POV: Of predators feasting on Paris. Carrying a youngling on its back, a female predator arrives late and can't find a place at the trough. With shocking apathy, it whips the youngling off its back and begins devouring it. Other predators start in-fighting, killing themselves for food. POV PANS to a pair of predators, closer, SOUNDING out new prey. POV PANS AGAIN to include the object of their desire. Audrey. CLOSE on Riddick. Trying to figure it out. CLOSE on Audrey. Listening to the HORRIFIC FEEDING SOUNDS. Oblivious to all the attention she's getting.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: What do you see? Riddick?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Hunger. I see 60 years of hunger.

scene.meta: As clouds mass.

Into a rising wind, the survivors range on. Audrey now carries Paris' torch, refueled and COUGHING FIREBALLS at regular intervals. Fry seems to be handling rear-point fairly well, until... The cutter sputters and dies. She ditches it and takes the torch from Audrey.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Bottle-count.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Four fulls, one half. That mean we're halfway there? I hope?

scene.meta: Good question. They've just been blindly following... The light on Riddick's back.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Can we pick up the pace?

scene.meta: Working like a mule, Johns growls to himself. "If you think you can do better...." Abruptly he slaps an arm across Imam's chest, spotting... A sled-track. In front of them. Fry hears a SHOTGUN RATCHET. She spins to see... Johns out of his chains. Moving forward. Jamming the shotgun into the back of Riddick's neck.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: We aren't completely stupid.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Stay in the light! Everybody! Stay in the fucking --

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: We crossed our own tracks.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: He's running us 'round in circles. Look for yourself. Look!

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Riddick? What the hell are you --

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Listen.

scene.meta: Imagine a hundred Geiger-counters next to a truckload of plutonium. That's the SOUND that rides the wind now.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Canyon ahead. I circled once to buy some time to think.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Think about what?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: About how to kill us and still get these cells to the skiff. Goddamnit, we're just doin' the heavy lifting for this prick!

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (answering Fry) About the girl.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: What about her?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: What it's gonna be like when we hit that canyon. With her bleeding.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: What're you jaw-jackin' about? Girl's not cut.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (agreeing) No. She's not.

scene.meta: It hits Fry like a two-by-four. She looks at Audrey.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: (confessing) I didn't want you to leave me there... back at the ship...that's why I didn't say anything....

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: No, we'd never....Oh, God, honey, you shoulda told me sooner.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: (finally getting it) Aw, this can't be happening to me....

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: They been nose-open for her ever since we left. They go off blood.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Well...we must keep her close, then. Here, she'll be safe if we put her between --

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (scanning) There is no "safe."

scene.meta: An epic beat. The wind gusts...the FLAMES CHATTER...their ears fill with CANYON SOUNDS.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: It's not gonna work. We gotta go back.

scene.meta: Johns brays.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Hey, you're the one who got me out here, turned me into a goddamn sled dog. An' now you 'spect me to go back like a whipped dog?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I was wrong. I admit it. My bad, okay? Now let's just go back to the ship.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: I dunno. Nice breeze, wide open spaces -- you know, I'm startin' to enjoy myself out here.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Are you fucking high again? Just listen to --

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: No, no, you're right, Fry. What's to be afraid of? My life is a steamin' pile of meaningless toadshit anyhow. So I say mush on! Canyon's only couple hundred meters, after that we're in Skiff City! So why don't you just butch up, stuff a cork in that kid, and get --

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: She's the captain, we should listen to --

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Listen to her? Her? When she was willing to sacrifice us all?

scene.meta: A beat. Eyes turn to Fry. She wants to protest -- but can't.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: What's he talkin' about?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: During the crash, she --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (a warning growl) This does not help us, Johns.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: -- she tried to blow the whole fucking passenger cabin, tried to kill us --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Just shut up, okay?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: -- tried to kill us in our sleep. Paris had it right -- we are disposable. We're just walking ghosts to her.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Would you RAG YOUR STUPID HOLE!

scene.meta: She rushes him, ready to rip his eyes out. He shunts her aside.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: We're not alive because of her -- we're alive in spite of her.

scene.meta: He swung below the belt -- and connected. Fry's chin quakes, her knees fail. The undertow of events finally pulls her down.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: We cannot go through there....

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: (lording) How much you weigh right now, Fry? Huh?

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: (pushing him back) Fine, fine, you've made your point. We can all be so scared as you.

scene.meta: Johns snatches a light away from Imam.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: (to all) Verdict's in. The light moves forward.

scene.meta: They trudge on, slower now, building reserves for the canyon-run. At rear-point, Fry follows like a broken rudder. Pilgrim #1 now draws the sled with Imam. And up ahead...
Johns falls in step with Riddick.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Ain't all of us gonna make it.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Just realized that, huh?

scene.meta: CLICKING nearby. Johns BLASTS the night, driving the sound away -- and reminding everyone of who carries the Big Gauge.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Six of us left. If we could get through that canyon and lose just one, that'd be quite a fucking feat, huh? A good thing, right?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Not if I'm the one.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: What if you're one of five?

scene.meta: Riddick stares. "I'm listening."

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: What're they doin' up there?

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Talking about the canyon, I suppose. How to get us through.

scene.meta: Overhearing, Fry looks. It's odd to see Johns and Riddick walking side by side, like equals. Like partners.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Look, it's hellified stuff -- but no different than those battlefield doctors when they have to decide who lives and who dies. It's called "triage," okay?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Kept calling it "murder" when I did it.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Either way, figure it's something you can grab onto.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (doping it out) Sacrifice play. Hack up one body, leave it at start of the canyon. Like a bucket of chum.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Trawl with it. There's a cable on the sled. We can drag the body behind us.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Nice embellishment.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Don't wanna feed these land-sharks -- just keep 'em off our scent.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (looking back) So which one caught your eye?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Don' look, don' look, don' look....

scene.meta: Fry spots Riddick's look -- and Johns' non-look.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Imam. Slow down.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: What?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Don't stop, just slow down. Little more space 'tween us and them.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: I would rather we all stay--

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Do what I say. Please.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: What's her name, anyway?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: What do you care?

scene.meta: Riddick shrugs. "I don't."

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Then let's not name the Thanksgiving turkey, okay? I assume you still got a shiv.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: What, you 'spect me to do it?

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: What's one more to you? Like this is the one that sends you to Hell?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Oh, you're a piece of art, Johns. They oughtta hang you in a museum somewhere. Or forget the museum -- maybe they should just hang you.

scene.meta: As Fry and the others keep slowing.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Awright. You do the girl, I'll keep the others off your back.

scene.meta: Riddick stops. Reconsiders.

char.name: JOHNS (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: Aw, don't tell me you're growin' scruples.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (shakes head) Just wonderin' if we don't need a bigger piece of chum.

char.name: JOHNS
char.dialogue: Like who, Mr. Chrislam?

scene.meta: EXTREMELY TIGHT on both men: In their eyes, we see the new partnership splintering apart: "Like Mr. Johns." Riddick makes a play for the shotgun. It BLASTS skyward.
As the fight erupts:

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Bring the light!

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: What're they doing? What're we --

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Leave the sled, let's go, go, go!

scene.meta: FIGHT SCENE: Johns' light hits the ground, creating an arena of illumination. FAST CLICKING nearby. Still struggling, Riddick and Johns somehow manage to gang-aim the shotgun and BLAST THE

char.name: CLICKING AWAY.
char.dialogue: The shotgun goes free. Johns lunges for it, but Riddick kicks it into the night. And then pulls his shiv.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Gotta stay in the light, Johns. That's the only rule.

scene.meta: Johns circles inside the light. Fucking with him, Riddick starts poking and jabbing, backing him up against the wail of dark. Johns stumbles over something. A bone. A club. Riddick finds his own bone-club, and now they go at it like two cavemen. Riddick beats on Johns' club-hand, breaking fingers, forcing him to drop the bone. Just trying to get away now, Johns makes a desperate lunge for the light, but... Riddick shivs open his back.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Remember that moment?

scene.meta: Gushing blood, Johns starts crawling pathetically with the light. Riddick dogs him.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Shoulda never took the chains off, Johns. You were one brave fuck, before. Now look at you. Oh, yeah, you were Billy Bad-ass with your gauge...with your chains....

scene.meta: Johns finds the shotgun. "And I'm still Billy Bad-ass." He sweeps it around with the light, ready to kill... Blackness. Where'd Riddick go? CLICKING behind Johns. He whirls to see... Something big coming for him. Johns BLASTS IT back into the night, dropping the light as he does. Eyes in the back of his head, he whirls again and takes aim on... Another bull-rushing predator. Johns triggers a bad round. Crazed, he ratchets and levels the shotgun for another try. He's too late. BIG CLOSEUP as the ejected shell rolls to a stop. It's red. Johns loaded a morphine shell in the dark. RIDDICK'S POV: With Johns skewered by the armpits, the predator lifts him off the ground and "stares" with a deceptively gentle

char.name: CLICKING-COOING SOUND.
char.dialogue: PREDATOR'S POV: Of Johns' final expression.

scene.meta: RIDDICK'S POV: The predator rears back its head -- then slams forward, hitting Johns with the full force of its skull-blade, splitting him in two.

Fry, Imam, Audrey, Pilgrim #1. They're running, stumbling, trying to backtrack the sled marks. Checking for pursuit, Fry looks over her shoulder... And crashes into Riddick. He was just standing in the dark, waiting for them.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Back to the ship, huh?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Get out of our way.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: So everybody huddles together till the lights burn out? Until you can't see what's eating you? That the big plan?

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Where's Mr. Johns?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Which half?

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: You mean....

scene.meta: Conflicted, they all look back. Audrey starts to puddle up.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Gonna lose everybody out here....

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: He died fast. And if we got any choice, that's the way we should all go out. (to Audrey, softly) Don't you cry for Johns. Don't you dare.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. CANYON RIM - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT
scene.meta: BLACK SCREEN. We hear the canyon in full cry now -- CLICKING... BATTLING BONE-BLADES...MATING CRIES...the RENDING OF FLESH and SNAPPING OF TENDON. Far below, twin flames appear as the survivors reach the gauntlet. Predators perch in FOREGROUND, just hulking silhouettes "watching" from a canyon rim.
They are but five: Fry, Riddick, Audrey, Imam, and Pilgrim #1. CLOSE on each face as they listen to the CANYON. There must be countless predators ahead.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: How many you see?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: One or two.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Audrey?

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Three full bottles. But almost time to refill.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Doesn't seem like enough to turn back on, does it?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Only see one way. Turn the sled over and drag it like that, girl down low. Light up everything we got -- and run through like dogs on fire.

scene.meta: A beat.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: (understanding) The sled as a shield....

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: And what about the cells?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: I'll take those.

scene.meta: She looks at him hard.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: We're just here to carry your light, aren't we? Just the torch-bearers.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Let's drop back an' boot up.

scene.meta: START on the power cells. They're been lashed together into one queue. Working amid the giant bones, Riddick crafts a new harness from the old straps. Close behind him, Imam is MUTTERING IN ARABIC.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: What're you doin'?

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Blessing you like the others. (off his look) It's painless.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: And pointless.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: (a beat) I see. Well, even if you don't believe in God, it doesn't mean He won't be --

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: You don't see.

scene.meta: Riddick shrugs into the harness, snugs it down.

char.name: RIDDICK (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: 'Cuz you don't spend half your life in lock-down with a horse-bit in your mouth and not believe. And you surely don't start out in a liquor store trash bin with an umbilical cord wrapped around your neck and not believe. Oh, absolutely I believe in God. And I absolutely hate the fucker.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: He will be with us. Nonetheless.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Give my blessing to the girl. She needs a spare.

scene.meta: The torches. Maxed out. Burning non-stop. Fry and Imam. Sled chains on. Lapping up O2. Each holding a torch. Pilgrim #1. Clutching a handlight. Audrey. Rolling under her sled-shield, becoming the turtle in a metal carapace. Riddick. Goggles on. He has no desire to see what horrors will surround them. There's just one path, anyway: Straight through.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: As fast as you can.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: You sure you can keep --

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: As fast as you can.

scene.meta: SLEW OF SHOTS: Fry and Imam on the move, dragging the shield fast. Audrey speed-crawling beneath. Pilgrim #1 tripping along behind the shield. And Riddick behind them all, face already tortured, pulling 200 pounds of stubborn-mule cargo -- yet somehow keeping pace. The torch flames, stretched by the wind, flank them in fire.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. CANYON RIM - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT
scene.meta: As predators launch from the rim.
First come the hatchlings, streaming right into their faces -- then veering away at the last second, repulsed by light. Next come FERAL SOUNDS overhead.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Don't look.

scene.meta: Thin blue liquid spatters them.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Do not look up.

scene.meta: More spattering. Fry looks up -- and stumbles when she beholds... A ceiling of predators. At the cusp of light, they dive and weave and dart, slashing each other in a rabid desire to SOUND OUT the humans below. It's like looking into a bucket of angry eels.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Keep going, keep going, keep going, keep going!

scene.meta: His voice whips them like the Devil's coxswain. Chastened, Fry keeps her eyes down and speed up. More blue blood showers down -- followed by entrails dropping out of the sky. Could this be Hell itself?

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: (a muttered mantra) "So dark the clouds around my way I cannot see, But through the darkness I believe God leadeth me. I gladly place my hand in His when all is dim, And, closing my weary eyes, lean hard on him...."

scene.meta: Now WHOLE CORPSES ARE CRASHING DOWN around them, victims of in-fighting. Fry and Imam start slaloming through the ghastly mess. Pilgrim #1 passes too close to a corpse: A blade slices his leg, drawing blood. He keeps his mouth shut.
The passage narrows into a choke-point. Fry sees it first.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Riddick? RIDDICK?

scene.meta: Ahead, a clot of dead predators blocks the canyon.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: What? What is it?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: It's a fucking staircase! Go over it! GO OVER IT!

scene.meta: Steeling themselves, they start climbing. But Audrey, on all fours, has to discover the corpses with her hands. Then, taking exception at being walked on... One "corpse" snaps at her. Audrey recoils sideways... And tumbles down the mound of corpses. She's exposed. PREDATORS' POV: Rapid-fire images of Audrey. Flashes from 10 different predators.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Audrey!

scene.meta: Audrey shakes out of it and scrambles for the shield just as... A predator kamikazes onto the shield, its bone-blades piercing the metal... And nearly skewering Audrey beneath. Caught in torchlight, steaming, the PREDATOR HOWLS as it tries to rip free of the shield. Beneath, Audrey hangs on and takes a thrashing. The predator tears clear, spins, pounces blindly at... Riddick, standing at light's edge. Stunningly, he catches the beast under its scythe blades, blunting the attack. The predator CLICKS MADLY at him. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Riddick's face. The predator rears back its head, ready to bisect Riddick with its skull-blade. Switchblade fast, Riddick drops a hand... ...yanks his shiv... ...and sweeps it over the belly of the beast. HOWLING, the predator falls, disemboweled. REACTION SHOTS of Fry and Imam. Stunned.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Didn't know who he was fuckin' with.

scene.meta: They regroup. Imam's head swivels back and forth: They're one person short.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Suleiman!

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Get the girl back under. Keep going.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: SULEIMAN!

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: KEEP GOING OR I WILL!

scene.meta: Suddenly Pilgrim #1 reappears, thrust back into the light by unseen forces. He's still alive -- but shouldn't be. He makes a feeble attempt to grab onto Imam, to anyone, but he's gone again before they can even react, jerked out of the light. Out of existence.

They flail on. And now, finally...finally.... The canyon widens, opening up like some door to Heaven. The WORST SOUNDS fall behind. We can see it in their sweat-sheened faces: The faintest hope that maybe they've survived the Seventh Circle of Hell. But then... The TORCHES SPIT AND SPUTTER. Audrey hears PATTERING on the metal shield. Blood falls anew. One torch dies -- yet somehow comes back to life. Imam upturns a hand, checking the liquid for color. But this blood has no hue.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Oh, no. No, no, no....

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Rain.

scene.meta: RAIN MONTAGE: Water rilling, running, flowing over rocks and ground.
Caught in a downpour, the survivors slog to a stop. One torch goes out -- and won't relight.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: So where the hell's God now, huh? (no answer from Imam) I'll tell you where! He's up there PISSING ON ME!

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Riddick? How close?

scene.meta: Riddick sheds goggles to look ahead. We don't know what he sees -- nor what he's thinking.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Tell me the settlement is right there! RIDDICK, PLEASE!

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: We can't make it.

scene.meta: HOLD on Fry's anguished face, rendered in dying torchlight. Somewhere behind, the AWFUL SOUNDS RETURN.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Here...hide here....

scene.meta: He's found a crevice in the canyon wall.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Inside...inside....

scene.meta: They crawl into the fissure. The second torch dies behind them.
There's just one light left now -- the one Riddick wears on his back. By its glow, we watch him lift the shield, muscle it over to the crevice...
...and slide it over the opening. A black beat.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: (a beat) Why's he still out there?

scene.meta: Fry's not sure. Is he protecting them? Or entombing them?

scene.sceneheader: EXT. MUDDY RISE - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT
scene.meta: Working like Sisyphus, Riddick hauls the cells up a muddy rise. He stops at the top, peers through the rain. RIDDICK'S POV: Of the settlement. Riddick disappears over the rise. The four cells follow, slithering through the mud like a serpent's tail.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: He's not coming back, is he?

scene.meta: Fry checks Imam's face. Did Riddick say anything to you?" Imam wags his head. A bleak beat -- before Fry realizes she can see his face.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: There's light in here.

scene.meta: It's a soft glow from above. Imam climbs higher to discover small blue-white lights clinging to rocks. He plucks a few.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: What are they?

scene.meta: CLOSE on the lights in Imam's palm. They writhe with life.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Larva....

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Glow worms....

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (mind racing) How many bottles we got? Empty ones?

scene.meta: Riddick boards the dark craft. Connects the power cells to the battery bay. Watches the ship come to life.
CLOSE on a liquor bottle. It's half full of glow-worms.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: More, more, we need more....

scene.meta: They climb higher. Little by little, the bottle brightens their world.

Drenched in light, Riddick stands in the hatchway of the skiff, looking out into dark rain. Is he struggling with a decision? Or just savoring the safe harbor? Then very deliberately... Riddick smashes his handlight on the hull. He steps inside and closes the hatch behind him.

scene.sceneheader: EXT. MUDDY RISE - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT
scene.meta: Something claws its way up the rise. Standing, we see that it's Fry, a bottle of glow-worms strung around her neck. Ahead she spies... The settlement. Silhouetted by engine-light.
As the skiffs ENGINES WARM UP.
As Riddick dabbles with flight controls.
As Fry, running, splashes past buildings.

Audrey and Imam huddle around a bottle of glow-worms: This is all they could harvest. Presently SCRABBLING SOUNDS on the shield. Imam eases one eye to a small hole in the shield. He can't see much until... A blade rushes through the hole. Imam recoils hard, snatches up the glow-worm light to see... More predator blades exploring the edges of the shield. The light drives them away. For now.

Riddick dims interior lights, activates exterior lights. He's actually startled by the sight of... Fry. Standing in the skiffs headbeams. Daring him to run her over. Eye-lock. Riddick opens the hatch.
They meet at opposite ends of the gangway -- Fry in the rain, Riddick in the light.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Strong survival instinct. Admire that in a woman.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: You're not leaving. Not until we go back for the others.

scene.meta: He laughs at that.

char.name: FRY (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: I promised them we'd go back with more light. And that's exactly what we're gonna do..

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Think you've mistaken me for somebody who gives a fuck.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: What, you're afraid?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Confusin' me with Johns now -- fear was his monkey. I only deal in life and death. All that stuff in between? Some shade of grey my eyes don't see.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I trusted you, Riddick. Goddamn, I trusted that some part of you wanted to rejoin the human race.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Truthfully? I wouldn't know how.

scene.meta: Fry realizes it's impossible to shame a shameless man. With desperation edging her voice:

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Then wait for me. I'll go back myself. Just give me more light for them.

scene.meta: He tosses her a light. The broken one.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Just come with me!

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Got a better idea. Come with me.

scene.meta: Fry's mouth moves but nothing comes out.

char.name: RIDDICK (CONT'D)
char.dialogue: They're already dead. Get on board.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: You're fuckin' with me. I know you are.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: 'Course I am -- but doesn't mean I won't leave you here. If you believe anything about me, better be that.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: No, you see, I promised them...I have to...I have to go and....

scene.meta: She's bleeding resolve. Riddick can see it -- can smell it -- and he keeps slashing away.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Step aboard, Carolyn.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: (tortured) I can't....I can't....

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (approaching, extending a hand) Here. Make it easy on you.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Don't do this to me....

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Just give me your hand.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: But they...they could still be....

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: No one's gonna blame you. C'mon. Take my hand and save yourself, Carolyn.

scene.meta: A beat. She takes his hand -- and jerks him down the gangway. They sprawl through mud. She gets a knee on his neck.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I will not give up on them! I Will not leave anyone on this rock with those fucking things, even if it means --

scene.meta: In a blur, Riddick rolls and slaps a shiv on her neck. Is history repeating itself? Riddick's face, though, is strangely calm. Curious. Even gentle.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: You'd die for them?

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I would try for them.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: You barely know them.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: But I'm human. I know you view that as a weakness, but I'm sorry -- I do feel fear, theirs too. Goddamnit, Riddick -- yes. I would die for them.

scene.meta: MORE SCRABBLING at the shield. Imam cocks his blade back, ready to do battle with... Fry. She heaves the shield aside. Behind her, Riddick.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: (big-eyed) You came for us....

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Yeah, yeah -- we're all fuckin' amazed. Anyone not ready for this?

scene.meta: Protected by the meager light of two glow-worm bottles, the four remaining survivors head out.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Tighter, tighter....

scene.sceneheader: EXT. MUDDY RISE - THE GAUNTLET - NIGHT

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Stop.

scene.meta: They pile up awkwardly. Fry listens hard. Only RAINFALL.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: I don't hear --

scene.meta: He covers her mouth. RIDDICK'S POV: Water has pooled at the base of the muddy rise. A predator drinks there.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: (on his breath) Doesn't see us...wait for it to leave....

scene.meta: RIDDICK'S POV: Another predator lands to drink. Then another. Their backs are to us, but the pool is turning into a major gathering place. Soon they all can hear CLICKING above the RAIN. Their nightmare is far from over.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Get behind me.

scene.meta: RIDDICK'S POV: Of a half-dozen predators shifting places at the pool. A slim gap appears.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: When I go, we go. Full-throttle.

scene.meta: CLOSE on their hands, gripping each other.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Ready...ready....

scene.meta: RIDDICK'S POV: The gap between predators widens into a passage. A gauntlet within a gauntlet. Riddick runs. Linked like paper dolls, the others follow blindly. RIDDICK'S POV: Of a predator turning to "stare" over its shoulder. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Riddick bearing down fast. The survivors hit the water like lawn mowers on legs, crashing through, scattering water and predators alike, managing to reach... The muddy rise. Audrey loses her grip on the others... And starts back-sliding. She CRIES OUT, turning the head of... Riddick. He catches Audrey as her legs hit the pool. He muscles her back up the rise and heaves her over the top, sending her slip-sliding down the other side.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: You know the way!

scene.meta: Not waiting for him, Fry and Imam disappear over the rise. RIDDICK'S POV: Of the predators. Regrouping. Crawling up the rise at us.
Fry, Imam, and Audrey run hard, glow-worm lights bouncing wildly. RIDDICK'S POV: Chasing them. PREDATOR'S POV: Chasing Riddick.
Fry, Imam, and Audrey reach the settlement. They spill around a corner and see... The light of the skiff.

RIDDICK'S POV: Ahead of us, we see Fry, Imam, and Audrey vanishing around the corner. BREATHING LIKE A RACEHORSE, we follow in their steps, storming around the same corner. Suddenly a predator is right there, right in our face. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Riddick skidding to a stop. He snaps a look up. RIDDICK'S POV: Of another predator perched gargoyle-like on the building. It SPEED-CLICKS at us. PREDATOR'S POV: Of Riddick slowly pulling two shivs. Bracing himself. Ready to blade it out.
Imam and Audrey stagger aboard. Safe in the light of the headbeams, Fry turns back, panting, waiting. Waiting.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: Captain....

scene.meta: He wants her to board the skiff. Fry gives it another beat, eyes sweeping the dark rain. And just when we think it's over for Riddick -- TERRIBLE SCREAMS are heard from both man and predator: There's a helluva fight going on out there. Close out there. Fry snatches the glow-worms off Imam's neck... And plunges into the darkness, homing in on the SOUNDS until... A blade flashes in her face. She ducks and spots... Riddick. Bloody, muddy, he's down on his knees, still trying to fight off the shadow-beasts that swirl and slash all around him. Around them both.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: It's me, it's me, it's me!

scene.meta: She gets the light around his neck. Now we see his face clearly -- and see a very human expression there: Fear. Fry grabs his armpits and tries to pull him up.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: C'mon, Riddick -- said I'd die for them, not you.

scene.meta: He gets his feet under him. Gripping each other, they start moving, turning like dancers in a macabre waltz, hoping the predators can't fix on Riddick's blood.

char.name: FRY
char.dialogue: Just 10 steps...keep turning, keep turning...that's right...others're already 'board, waitin' for us right now...five steps...c'mon, almost there, Riddick... almost there...we're almost --

scene.meta: Something jolts them. ALL CLICKING STOPS. EXTREME CLOSEUPS: Searching each other's eyes. Someone just got slashed from behind, slashed bad. But who?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Not for me....

scene.meta: In an eyeblink she's gone, ripped from his arms. There was no scream. No cry. No final words. Just... Blackness.
Out of the blackness, a spot of fire races toward us. It resolves into the skiff, fabric wings burning off as it hits escape velocity.

CLOSE on a bloody hand. It toggles through nav-charts, plots a rendezvous with "Sol-Track 17B" shipping lane. In the cockpit, Riddick finds Audrey beside him. She stares hypnotically at the stars ahead.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Probably okay to talk to me now.

char.name: AUDREY
char.dialogue: Not sure where to go. I was just runnin' away when this whole thing started. (a beat) Where you goin'?

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Not sure. I was just runnin' away when this whole thing....

scene.meta: Interior smiles. Stars sweep the windscreen as the skiff makes a course-correction. One very bright star comes into view.

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Might interest you....

scene.meta: Imam moves forward. Seeing, his face lifts.

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: New Mecca....

char.name: RIDDICK
char.dialogue: Think a soul could get lost there? With all those pilgrim-types?

char.name: IMAM
char.dialogue: It's more a place where souls are found, Mr. Riddick.

scene.meta: As Riddick ponders the possibilities, we CUT TO...
The first sun flares out from behind the eclipsing planet. Its light feels cleansing. Renewing. Life-giving.
